Para la versión en Español, haz click aquí // Für die deutsche Version, klick hier
The Pioneers Collection will have an extra augmented reality feature that turns the box into a cinema from the past!
Marey's backflip jump chronophotography. This poster is part of the Limited Edition Poster Reward.

Needless to say, we fully agree with this. We had been dedicated to filmmaking for more than 20 years before we embarked on the adventure of starting our own flip book publishing house, and we loved the idea of doing a project that combined both worlds: flip books and cinema.
THE PIONEERS is a tribute to these very earliest trailblazers. A collection of ten cinemagic flip books that represent the essence of their works, the very first projects involving the moving image ever made. 
This collection is a declaration of love for those pioneering talents who sowed the seeds of a revolution that is now a fundamental part of our lives: the cinema.
It was no easy task to narrow down the selection of outstanding pioneers to ten. In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, these innovators spent years refining their techniques, implementing new technologies and discovering unique optical tricks in no way inferior to those of modern-day YouTubers and TikTokers.
During our research we kept coming across female pioneers, great creators who managed to assert themselves in a male-dominated world, but unfortunately very few of their works have survived, and they have now largely fallen into obscurity. We are proud to include two of them, namely the great Alice Guy-Blaché and Lotte Reiniger, in this selection.
Finally, we have come to a great lineup of ten visionary figures, who we consider to be major revolutionaries in their field, whether from the primitive beginnings of the moving image, such as the phenakistiscope and chronophotography, or from the early days of cinematography, animation, optical tricks and the first forms of on-screen narrative.
Scroll down to discover each of the people who make up this collection in more detail.
Those of you familiar with the Flipboku flip books know that we like a little magic! Our flip books feature a clever trick that owes its success to a sophisticated assembly technique, and this is why we call them cinemagic flip books. As a result, when flipping the pages of the book, you can see up to six different animations instead of one or two like in a normal flip book. Let the entertainment commence!
This eye-popping optical illusion allows us to include an impressive 60 film sequences in The Pioneers Collection, representing the first decades of the history of the moving image, from the phenakistiscope to the first colorized films.
Our cinemagic flip books are surprisingly easy to use and provide an unfailing source of delight to viewers of all generations.

But there’s more to discover with this collection: in addition to the six film sequences hidden inside the flip book, each edition features a micro-documentary on the life of the respective pioneers, which adds an extra dimension to the experience of learning about their work. These documentaries will be incorporated into each of the flip books using augmented reality and are viewable by simply scanning the cover with a smartphone or tablet.  
This feature allows us to add another dimension to the Pioneers Collection as well as an extra educational resource - it's a great way to learn more about each artist's life, their background and their most outstanding works. The feature will be available thanks to an easy-to-use iOS and Android app developed by our friends from Artivive, a revolutionary AR company based in Vienna, Austria.
To access the AR content, simply scan the QR code included in the flip book, install the Artivive App, open it and view the flip book on your screen. Easy peasy!
It was important to us to not only create a pleasing artifact for people's bookshelves but also to give the edition an additional educational purpose, bringing the stories of each pioneer to younger generations in a fun and interactive way. We have taken the collection to schools and film schools and have received exceptionally good feedback both from the students and teachers.
Students can discover the film material in an engaging interactive way using a medium that represents a precursor of cinema itself, while at the same time, thanks to augmented reality, the collection bridges the gap between old-school and cutting-edge technology. A truly unique educational tool for all generations.





For this edition, we have taken great care with the details.
Since most of the sequences are in black and white, we liked the idea of contrasting the design with a vibrant color palette, using elements from the film footage for the cover pages and sleeves.
Some of the creators, whose projects preceded the cinema itself, worked with inventions such as the phenakistiscope in the case of Joseph Plateau or chronophotographic techniques in the case of Étienne-Jules Marey and Eadweard Muybridge, and we have turned these into animations in order to see them in action. In the case of Marey, because these are overexposed photographs that capture movements in action, the result is pretty astounding. 
For the other filmmakers, we have researched and watched hours of footage from each of them, finding truly extraordinary treasures, and although we have tried to provide a balanced selection of their filmographies, it is impossible to do them complete justice after discovering so much wonderful material.

Once all the material was selected, we proceeded to subject them to digital restoration and then focused on the design of each edition. 
We've created an exclusive limited edition reward that includes, besides from the Pioneers Flip Book Collection, a unique print of Étienne-Jules Marey's backflip jump chronophotography.  This technique was achieved by overlapping celluloid prints one on top of the other, making it possible to discover the different stages of movement, in order to study their relationship to each other in a single image. It is without a doubt one of our favorite images. This reward also includes the full set of AR postcards created exclusively for the campaign.
For this campaign we have come up with several appetizing bundles, which may eventually find their way onto your bookshelves.
By way of a taster, we’ve created an attractive set of 10 cinematic postcards, one for each filmmaker, perfect for mailing or to be used as bookmarks. Like the flip books, these postcards include the augmented reality feature and each of them will reproduce a micro-documentary with extra information when scanned through the Artivive app on your smartphone or tablet.
Flipboku is the brainchild of animator and designer Jossie Malis and film music composer Julie Reier. We have both been working in the world of film for many years and love all things related to animation, books and design. We loved the idea of having our own flip book publishing house, so we started the project in 2016 and it has grown steadily since then.
Today, the Flipboku team is made up of seven members, all working in our design and printing studio Boku Lab in Palma de Mallorca, Spain. The rest of the team consists of the invaluable hands of our two illustrators and graphic designers Noemi Aiolo and Erika Godino, and our irreplaceable production technicians Gustavo Berdayes, Tomás Pons and José Ramón Pineda, responsible for the entire production process.
Since 2019 we have had our own printing workshop where 100% of the production is carried out. This means that the entire production process is under our control, allowing for precise results and finishes, in harmony with our commitment and obsession with design and quality. It took us several years to refine our cinemagic flip books and their optical illusion features, but thanks to the talented hands of our experienced print masters, we were able to fine-tune the concept to perfection.
Here you can get a glimpse of the super effective teamwork of the Boku crew:

Even though we are already experienced flip book makers, there’s a lot of work that goes into developing an entire collection like The Pioneers. We’ve spent endless time researching, going through hours of film footage while contacting museums, film archives and production companies to find the best material. Then we had to restore and set up each of the 60 sequences and make them suitable for a flip book format.
Now we need your help to complete the final step – to bring the flip books to life and get them to the printers. While our print team works on the production, we’ll focus on planning the development and production of the ten micro-documentaries, one for each author.
Therefore, we’ll need even more footage from archives that needs to be edited and subsequently processed; ten scripts have to be written, voice-over-recorded and mixed, which also applies to the music for each film. Finally, all this content has to be integrated as augmented reality into each flip book.

Shipping will be charged AFTER THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN, during the survey stage.
Below is an estimate of shipping costs broken down by shipping area. These are only estimates; however we commit to these prices being the maximum amount you will have to pay.

ADD ONS:
All individual flip books and bundles can be added to your pledge AFTER THE CAMPAIGN and at the same cost. We intentionally chose not to offer Kickstarter add-ons within the campaign to keep the survey process as easy as possible for everyone. Shipping costs for add-ons will be charged by weight; this way we can calculate them as precisely as possible. 
*Shipments for all flip book bundles will include tracking. For the postcards you will be able to choose between tracked and ordinary shipping; the price list shows ordinary shipping rates. The shipping costs are expressed in Euros and US dollars.
We are extremely grateful for your support and would love to see you on board!
Special thanks to our friends from Artivive, Caroline Hall, Christel Strobel, Ghent University Museum, Marjan Doom, Bibliothèque des Archives françaises du film, L’œuvre cinématographique des frères Lumière, Filmoteca de Catalunya, Filmoteca Española, Internet Archive, Pathé Archives, Cinémathèque Française, Hartley Moorhouse, Alexander Anderson, Marmoset Music, Tumalo, Beatriz Tejeiro, Jonathan García, Backercamp,  Daniela Sanchez, ICEX Next, and IEB Institut d'Estudis Balearics.
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $300MM through crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After 4 successful Kickstarter projects, we have optimized our workflow to ensure that both production and shipping run smoothly. The most important lesson we learned from our first projects is that no matter how well prepared you are, you will always have to reckon with unexpected situations as long as you are dependent on third-party providers. This is why we set up our own printing workshop, and 100% of all the production process is now carried out there. Our experienced printing technicians will personally take care of the printing process to ensure that production is executed to perfection, so that all our backers receive a product of the highest possible quality and as quickly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
All images are mockups created in adobe illustrator, artwork sizing may vary. Stamp color and disc color will be random, based on our choosing and manufacturer supply.
Here's Why We Need Your Contribution:
Truthfully, like you, we just enjoy the heck out of this great sport and want to see it keep growing. We want to be a brand that bridges the gap for everyone to have a good game and a good time. We will achieve this by stamping our own ridiculous artwork on all your favorite discs. We're also including a tips sticker that is specific to each disc, this is great on-the-spot learning for new and recreational players. We 100% believe in our product and it's message, and we need your help to bring us to life! We want to stamp so many more discs and continue to grow, nine is a good place for us to start! The designs are approved, the discs have been identified, and we are ready to start stamping!

Here's how we're using the money:
Mostly on - Custom Hot Stamped Discs ordered from Innova, Dynamic Discs and Latitude 64 with our own branded artwork.
Some on- Custom Hot Stamped Minis with The Mini Flyer stamp
The rest on- Custom stickers that are intended for the back of each disc. They will have tips and details specific to the disc that help improve your game, if needed (this is great on-the-spot information for new and recreational players) because we want to GROW THE SPORT!

Things to be aware of:
Discs will not necessarily be white, or any certain color for that matter. It's random, based on manufacturer supply. That's what's easiest for our manufacturers and to be perfectly honest, sounds more fun that way.
Hot stamps are specific to the disc. For example you cannot pick what stamp you want on what disc. (Although, we hope to change this in the future.)
The stickers are included and intended for the back of each disc, but DON'T WORRY they WILL NOT come pre-stuck to the back of the discs. That's up to you!
So What's Being Stamped On What?    
All images are mockups created in adobe illustrator, artwork sizing may vary. Stamp color and disc color will be random, based on our choosing and manufacturer supply.

What About The Other Stuff?
All images are mockups created in adobe illustrator, artwork sizing may vary. Stamp color and disc color will be random, based on our choosing and manufacturer supply.
 What If This Thing Takes Off?
We are more than stoked that we have hit our goal! It's unbelievable, thank you for helping us bring this beast to life! 
If this thing happens to go max heat and get all crispy, we want to make sure that it's not just to our benefit. Which is why we have prepared for you some kickass items that will be added to your reward if these said goals are met. 
A Little More:
Angry Goose’s Mission is to give everyone the confidence to play disc golf. People choose Angry Goose because our culture is about having fun, introducing people to the sport, and teaching everyone to take their game to the next level.

 Short Term Goal: Take the best performing discs, make them really, really good looking — and teach you the basics of using them.
 Long Term Goal: Make our own best performing discs with the same good-looking style.

Follow us on Instagram! Once all of our discs are out there in the world, we want to see and share all of your ridiculous disc pics. @angrydiscs
You want a closer look, eh?
Go for it, take it in, savor it, dream about throwing it, talk to your mom about it, add it to your notes, text yourself about it, bring it up in your next virtual meeting, screen shot it print it off and hang it on your wall.

updates.update_userinfo: The Goose has landed, I repeat the Goose has landed.
updates.update_content:
We're excited to say that we have started shipping orders!
Most of the Innova discs arrived yesterday which means we boxed up our first orders. We'll be starting with backer #1 and going right down the list.

As discs begin to arrive, please do two things:

Just want to say that we are still here, and thinking about how awesome you are.

Good News: 
We received our order from Dynamic Discs and the stamps are so, so tasty. If you want to see what some of them look like, go check out our Instagram here! 
We've also shipped out all of your t-shirts since discs are taking longer than expected, we thought that might be nice.

Late last week we sent out surveys to all our backers, I'd say about 90% of you have responded. Which is great! For those of you that haven't responded or haven't seen a survey, check your junkbox, spam, and trash. We are not at all ashamed to say that our email could be in any one of those places.

So here's the scoop on what's going down with Angry Goose,

What's up Backers! We did it!
Thank you all so, so much. Angry Goose is Happy today... haha, but truly, we are grateful for the opportunity to turn this fun dream into a reality. We will be tastefully stamping discs with absurd artwork for many years to come.

updates.update_userinfo: I think we're off to a great start!
updates.update_content:
There's 24 hours left and we are basically 250% backed. Yeah, we rounded up. Now we're on our way to being successfully kickstarted. We can't wait to continue on our path building this brand into what you deserve for believing in us. It's not going to be easy, but we will continue to deliver tastefully stamped discs that no one honestly needs.

Looking forward to connecting with you all in a few days as we send out surveys seeing what discs you would like and retrieving your mailing address. So be on the lookout!

We just broke 10k today... That's 200% backed! You've brought us to life, and now we're going to give this sport something it never needed, ridiculous stamps. For that, we cannot thank you enough! 

Two things you can expect from us once the Kickstarter has finished:
A survey sent to your email to get your address and the discs you want.

updates.update_userinfo: PLEASE READ: Yesterday we faced some unforeseen challenges
updates.update_content:
Going to try and not overthink this update too much and be as transparent with you all as possible. We're facing a real bummer here. After speaking with one of our manufacturers yesterday, we found that they are facing some serious disc drought. Some of the discs we wish to stamp artwork on could be out of stock anywhere from months to a year. Because of this, we are changing three (3) of the discs that will be stamped on. 

I will say that initially we crapped our pants, but we took a deep breath, said "it is what it is" and we are going to stay positive! We'll be spending the next few days updating the Kickstarter with the new information regarding the disc change. The artwork is all staying the same and so is the disc type. So, if the disc was a distance driver then it is still a distance driver.

updates.update_userinfo: THANK YOU! Here are some stretchy goals
updates.update_content:
We are more than stoked that we have hit our goal this early! It's unbelievable, we really do appreciate all of you for seeing our vision of being this ridiculous disc golf brand that just has fun. I have no doubt we will grow the sport together!
Alright, the heartfelt crap is over. If this thing happens to go max heat and get all crispy, we want to make sure that it's not just to our benefit. Which is why we have prepared for you some kickass items that will be added to your reward if these said stretch goals are met.

Thank you all so much! It's been less than 48 hours and we reached the $5,000 goal. That is amazing and if we're being perfectly honest, completely unexpected. Seriously, 48 hours! What!? We even have some backers in Canada, New Zealand, and Germany! So cool!

Well, we are going to celebrate tonight and tomorrow we will keep on keeping on! A whole lot of campaigning left to do. Obviously we need to come up with some sort of stretch goal. :)

campaign.story:
Welcome to the kickstarter campaign for the Hydrogen putter made by new Danish disc golf company, Løft Discs.
Hydrogen is a putter for both putting and short range driving in disc golf. The design is optimized virtually through our cutting-edge flight path simulator to create the straightest small diameter putter possible within the Professional Disc Golf Association standards, while still offering great grip comfort for both putting and driving.
Distance in meters


The flight of the Hydrogen is truly unique: Being a very low speed disc, it can hold an anhyzer for any shot between 30 and 90 meters (100 and 300 ft) without neither turning over or flattening out. Likewise, on a hyzer, it will hold the line without flipping up or hyzering additionally. Throw it flat, and watch it go straighter than any other disc you have ever thrown! This is why the disc has the flight characteristics of:
SPEED: 1       GLIDE: 2
TURN: 0         FADE 0
The exact same properties carry over when putting. With the hydrogen you don’t have to compensate for your putter being too overstable and you don’t have to worry about it flipping over in a headwind putt. Additionally the disc has a rather low glide, ensuring that it will drop to the ground fast in the rare case that you miss the target.
Hydrogen is designed to hold it's line as well as possible within the standards of the PDGA - but not at any cost. Moving the weight of the disc as far away from the middle as possible is one of the ways to make a disc fly straight, so in theory a large diameter disc turns and fades more slowly than a small diameter disc. But we wanted to make sure that the disc made sense to use as a putter, so comfort would always have to be a priority. We wanted to maintain the excellent comfort that small diameter putters have. And on top of that, a small diameter also serves the purpose of lowering wind resistance, lowering glide, and most importantly: Making it easier to hit and stay in the basket! So within this framework, we optimized the straightness of Hydrogen with four key physical features: 
Measurements in millimeters
The flight plate is very thin towards the middle, thickening towards the outer edge of the disc. This moves mass away from the center, and also makes the disc feel a little more shallow near the rim of the disc.
The rim is very thin and pretty blunt on the outside, which increases drag (ie. lowering the speed) and decreases the overall pitch moment, which means that no matter if the disc is turning or fading, it is doing it more slowly.
The parting line is the line on the outermost edge of the flight plate, which is one of the key parameters to change a disc's stability. This line is placed at the exact spot that gives the most neutral stability possible for the speed Hydrogen is designed to be thrown at, which is rather low speeds. Therefore, you will rarely see this disc fade, unless thrown really nose up. And likewise, you will only see the disc turn when thrown really hard.
The flatness and the shoulder profile of the disc ensures low glide. besides making the disc stay in the air longer, glide also makes a disc drift further to the sides when it isn't flying flat, which is very helpfull in some situations, but for the Hydrogen we wanted the disc to push straight forward, even thrown on a bit of anhyzer - or hyzer like you can see in the clip below.
PLAY

The disc will be released in two high-end plastic variants. The α-Solid plastic is our most durable plastic. It offers excellent grip for driving purposes, while having a medium stiffness and a shiny surface finish. The β-Solid plastic is our putter-optimized plastic. It is relatively stiff, but still with a great grip and a slightly tacky feel. The Beta plastic beats in quicker, allowing you to have various amounts of wear and tear of the same mold.
Our stamp is based on our logo, which forms the word 'løft' [ˈløfd] meaning lift or levitate in Danish. Our version of the peculiar letter, Ø, that is framing the entire stamp is a recurring reference to our name and to our Danish origins. We deliberately foresee that non-scandinavians will pronounce our name "loft", which correlates nicely to the meaning of the word.
The box with the disc's name is a reference to the periodic table - also refereing to our scientific approach to disc design. Therefore we used the chemical symbol H for Hydrogen, but instead of keeping the atomic number and weight etc. we used the four conventional flight characteristics; speed (top left), glide (top right), turn (bottom left) and fade (bottom right). 
We use elements from the periodic table to name all our discs. This has the benefit that discs can be categorized in two axis: Stability and speed. We use the periodic system so you already by hearing the name, can determine whether it is a overstable, understable, high speed or low speed disc. Names for elements with fewer protons in the top of the periodic table are used for low speed discs. Names for elements with fewer valence electrons to the left are generally used for more understable discs. 

Disclaimer: Hydrogen is not understable, even though it is to the left in the periodic table. We just only had 2 choices for the lowest speed.
We aim for making all discs 174-176 grams, but they will all be more than 172 grams.

We expect to deliver as soon as April 2021!

If you ship to outside of European Union, keep in mind that local import fee and taxation may apply. This, however, is not the case in Norway, Iceland, Lichtenstein and Switzerland.

Being founded in the summer of 2020, Løft Discs might seem like another crazy Covid-19 isolation idea. But it is far from that. Through half a year of collaboration with Kastaplast on his bachelor's project in mechanical engineering, founder Niels Sørensen developed the beginning of what today is our flight path simulator. With the assistance of good friend, economist and founder, Asger Sandahl, they succeeded in actually simulating flight paths of discs in 3D. This sparked the idea of using the tool to develop discs, instead of relying solely on assumptions and epxperience. 
Soon the idea of optimizing a putter with regards to flying as straight as possible was born. They joined forces with Kasper Jakobsen, who, with his education in IT and product development and experience in video production seemed like the perfect match.
Since then, it has been all hard work, and Løft Discs is more than ready to present their ideas to the world!


Løft discs is much more than a kickstarter project. Our vision for the future is to make the highest quality discs for all purposes and push the boundaries for disc golf discs. 

New Molds
We have already started the design phase on our next 3 molds launching as soon as we have the resources to do so. The more support we can get through Kickstarter, the quicker the world will see our next discs. 
Online Flight Path Simulator
Next year we launch the Beta-version of our 3D flight path simulator for everyone to try out. You will be able to compare every Løft disc with the most popular discs on the market. We will over time grow the disc library of the tool, but it can take several days of work to extract data from one single disc.
Tournaments
we are commited to grow the sport. Therefore we strive to help organizers make great tournaments, both smaller and bigger ones. We have already co-sponsored two danish tournaments and are planning more for the future. 
Material Research
The "Solid" part of Alpha-Solid and Beta-Solid refers to the relative stiffness of the material. We plan to expand with Alpha-Liquid and Beta-Liquid - Softer and even more grippy variants of the  two plastics, that will also have much less rebounce against trees and other obstacles.  Furthermore, we will start researching for the next generation of plastics: Theta-Solid and Theta-Liquid - Environmental friendly materials that will be bio-based and/or bio-dgradeable, so that we in the future can reduce the environmental footprint of the sport. The name, "Theta", is a hint to the Ecology Flag that has the greek letter Theta on it.
In 5 years
We love disc golf - and we believe that we can help the sport to grow even more. Our hopes and expectations are therefore to be one of the major golf discs producers within the coming 5-8 years. We have so much to offer that the sport haven't seen before and we hope to be able to share our ideas with the amazing disc golf community. We see no limits for neither us or disc golf as a sport - Even though there are only 118 elements in the periodic table ...so far.

campaign.story:
Stairslide is a patent-pending, semi-permanent children's slide for indoor stairs—a safer alternative to using a sleeping bag, cardboard box, or something worse! We're looking at you, kid in the laundry basket wearing aviator goggles!
 Stairslide's Patent-Pending Design!
Use Stairslide to slide down any straight staircase in the house. Our patent-pending design securely positions the slide against your stairs without the need for permanent anchoring or installation.
(Pro Tip: We recommend inspecting Stairslide after each use; if it has moved a little, simply reposition it against the stairs to ensure safety.)  
We designed Stairslide to nest on top of other Stairslide pieces so they can extend to cover more stairs. In other words, you can use a single Stairslide on the bottom three stairs or use three Stairslides to cover approximately nine stairs. It all depends on your appetite for thrill...Still looking at you, kid wearing aviator goggles!      
Keeping the Slide Secure 
Stairslide's patent-pending design uses unique features to prevent it from moving during use.  Made with durable, high-tensile strength plastic, Stairslide can withstand frequent use. It's surprisingly light weight, which makes it easy to adjust or reposition on stairs. We chose this material over less durable (and less expensive) options that would otherwise be discarded after normal wear and tear. Providing a long-lasting solution allows our customers to add additional Stairslides to their collection as little ones grow and become more adventuresome. Collect all colors!
Stairslide Dimensions
Stairslide is over 40 inches long and approximately 20 inches wide with a 14 inch seat, leaving room to use the adjacent stairs (most stairwells are at least 36 inches wide). We recommend placing Stairslide against one wall and using the space next to Stairslide to climb the stairs. Please measure your stairwell to ensure sufficient space before purchasing Stairslide. A single Stairslide weighs over five pounds. 
How Many Stairslides Do I Need?
Not all stairs are alike. But start with the number of stairs you're trying to cover and divide by three (round up, of course) since Stairslide covers approximately three steps and they are designed to overlap a bit! Get two or three Stairslides for six steps. Get three or four Stairslides for nine steps. Etc. We recommend placing the bottom of Stairslide on the first step above ground floor to allow your child to step off at the ground floor.  
 How Did We Get Here? 
The process started with a simple, rough sketch. Then we worked with an industrial engineer to create a small model using a 3D printer. But the pieces would not fit together in a way that allowed the slide to stay in tact on the stairs. 
3D Printed Model
Then we tried to scale Stairslide with a few adjustments that were meant to duplicate what we see on the playground. Clearly, this was not going to work because it was too heavy and too bulky.
Stairslide Prototype 1.0
We realized not all stairs are created equal. Stairs' rise and tread measurements can vary. And we wanted a solution that would accommodate a variety of stairs. So we started playing around with the "telescoping" feature. And the first prototype had curved handles at the top of the slide (see image). But it was too heavy and it frequently fell down the stairs during use.
Some stairs are carpeted. Some are wood. And we were determined to create something that can be used on just about any size or construction material.
After a little tweaking we finally figured it out! We finalized the design and had the final prototype made for testing.   
Rewards
Back us early and score up to 40% off the expected retail price of Stairslide! The standard color is white and additional colors were unlocked as we achieved our stretch goals. Shipping costs are not included. We will handle shipping after our crowdfunding campaign ends. We're still looking into estimates.
Stretch Goals
Thanks to our backers we've achieved all of our stretch goals and unlocked four new color options! Thank you! Backers can select their color after our crowdfunding campaign(s). We'll reach out and get your selection.
Other Ways You Can Help
We realize some wish to contribute to our Stairslide campaign but cannot make a financial contribution. There are still numerous ways you can help. And we would be ever-so grateful!
Get the word out and make some noise for us! Share the Stairslide campaign with you friends and family on all of your social media accounts using the Kickstarter share tools!
Report counterfeit products or fraudulent copy-cat sites. Our patent-pending Stairslide is such a great idea that disreputable people will pretend to offer it and steal your money. Report them to PayPal, Facebook, Instagram, etc.

 When Will I Get My Stairslide? 
Fulfilling orders may take some time. We want to deliver Stairslide to you by mid-April. But first, we need to finish our 40-day Kickstarter campaign. Then wait for funding. Then create the mold. Then bulk production. Then shipping.
The production lead time for a mold is about 45 days and bulk production lead time is approximately 55 days. That means we need funding from Kickstarter by November 15 and orders need to ship out to you by April 01 if we are to achieve our mid-April delivery goal.

 Who's Piloting This Project? 
Jacob is a family man--a father to five amazing kids and second in command to his super supportive wife. He's an entrepreneur with executive experience starting and operating product-based companies.
Craig's also a family man with four darling children and a very patient wife, whose orders (requests, really) he tries to follow with exactness. Craig has helped build several companies, leading marketing and product innovation. Check out his other successful Kickstarter campaign: PEEjamas!  
Our story is simple. Jacob's kids love to slide down the stairs. They used to use sleeping bags. Jacob's wife was concerned about their safety. One day she asked Jacob to invent something safer that could be stored when not in use. Jacob reached out to his neighbor, Craig. He loved the concept. They launched Stairslide. The end.   
As one of the first crowdfunding marketing agencies, Enventys Partners has brought more than 750 crowdfunding projects to life through lead generation, campaign page creation, public relations, email marketing, Facebook Advertising, campaign management and more.
Why Do We Care?
We care about families. We care about preserving the carefree innocence of childhood. And we care about safety. We designed Stairslide to be as safe as possible without compromising important features like the ability to easily store it when not in use, durability, nesting, etc. 
Some backers have asked about a weight limit. Ongoing field testing has yielded promising results. Stairslide can support a person up to 175 lbs without signs of structural weakness when used properly. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we work to make recommendations that help ensure the safety of our users.
Using Stairslide in any way other than its intended use may result in injury. Such risks simply cannot be eliminated without jeopardizing the essential qualities of Stairslide. Stairslide may need to be adjusted slightly after repeated use. We recommend inspecting Stairslide's position on the stairs after each use; if it has moved away from the back side of a stair's tread simply reposition it to help ensure safety. 
 Tell Me About The Budget!
Delivering on time and as promised is important to us. We sourced multiple manufacturer quotes for Stairslide's components and concluded that single-sourcing Stairslide will give us the highest chance for success. The quote we agreed to includes cost of materials, labor, assembly, and shipping Stairslide to a place where the bulk order can be broken down for individual shipments. Naturally, the mold tooling is the largest expense.
We've further broken down the categories into individual components. It's likely we'll be able to find more cost effective suppliers over time, however the budget provides a reasonable basis for determining a ceiling on our funding.

We need your help to take Stairslide to market. We will do our best to deliver Stairslide as promised, but our project has some risks that include:

1) Manufacturing Delays: Our timeline is a conservative estimation that includes a few "buffer" days in the event of unforeseen delay. We want to under-promise and over-deliver. But there is no way to guarantee Stairslide will be produced by our published date.

We can, however, guarantee transparency and accountability so that backers are not surprised by bumps in the road.

2) Product Design Changes & Product Challenges: Stairslide's final prototype works. We've used it ourselves. But there are always limitations to testing; not all stairs are the same. And feedback from backers or customers may result in the need to adjust the design down the road. If there are ways to optimize packaging by changing the design then we may consider that. We may need to alter our design to compensate for alternative components. Since we have limited control over the raw material suppliers that our manufacturer uses there is a risk that Stairslide's structural integrity could be compromised.

We will work closely with our supplier(s) to ensure Stairslide is manufactured according to specification.

3) Shipping: Stairslide is a relatively heavy and bulky item. And expected shipping costs will be consistent with its weight and size. Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We've designed Stairslide using high density ABS plastics that can withstand frequent use over a long period time. We chose this material over less durable (and less expensive) options that would otherwise be discarded after normal wear and tear. Providing a long-lasting solution allows our customers to add additional Stairslides to their stairs as little ones grow up and become more adventuresome.
Reusability and recyclability
Stairslide is made of Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS) plastic, which is a thermoplastic material that can be easily recycled.

updates.update_userinfo: Completing the CrowdOx Order Management Survey
updates.update_content:
We had a (much-needed) conference call with fulfillment yesterday. UPS now says to expect a decision on the conditional variance waiver by mid-May. So we made an executive decision.
We are going to begin fulfilling orders for five slides in addition to the orders for 1-4 and 7+ slides. For these orders of five slides, fulfillment will have to remove the rubber strip from the bottom of each Stairslide and place it inside the box with the Stairslides. This will allow the slides to fit in the box without changing its dimensions and incurring an additional $16 oversize fee. Once you receive your pledge reward, you'll need to re-attach the rubber strip to its proper place underneath Stairslide before using it.

We had a (much-needed) conference call with fulfillment yesterday. UPS now says to expect a decision on the conditional variance waiver by mid-May. So we made an executive decision and will send an update to Spoiling Grandpa and Loving Aunt backers separately.
Q: I received a duplicate order. What gives?
A: Apparently, a number of backers have received twice as many slides for which they pledged. According to fulfillment, their order management software integrated with CrowdOx in a way that created duplicate orders. Not all orders. Just some of them. They caught most of them but apparently a number slipped through the cracks. Normally, we'd just have backers keep the extra slides. But the purchase order for crowdfunding inventory was limited to the number of slides that were pledged plus a very modest margin of error. So we worry that if someone gets extra, that could impact what another backer gets (especially for colored slides). We respectfully (and sheepishly) ask that if you receive duplicate orders to please notify us. We will send you a return shipping label along with our most sincere apologies for the inconvenience.

Hey Stairsliders!
This last year has been rough on a lot of us, but we’ve made it through with a little help from our friends.
We wanted to share something our friends at Pillow Cube came up with called Pillow Cubs. They are fun, lovable pillows for your kids that will quickly become their favorite toy and will help them go to bed so fast it will be your favorite too!

updates.update_userinfo: A Little Help For A Friend
updates.update_content:
The first container included colored Stairslides only. So we began fulfilling orders for just colored Stairslides. The 2nd container included Landing Pads and only a few white Stairslides. So we began fulfilling the orders for colored slides and Landing Pads (and only a few with white slides). The 3rd container (arrived Monday) and it contains all white Stairslides. But we hit an unfortunate snag with UPS last week that compelled us to temporarily pump the breaks.
Apparently, our box size exceeds UPS' maximum girth dimensions without incurring an "oversize" fee. UPS changed how they qualify an "oversize" parcel  after our boxes were purchased and this was not communicated to us. As a result, up four slides are able to fit in a box unless the customer wants to pay an additional (and substantial) "oversize" fee. And we assumed no one wants to pay more for shipping than they already have. So we submitted a conditional variance waiver request. We hope to hear back from UPS within the next few days on the approval. In the meantime, fulfillment was instructed to ship orders for four slides or less and orders of seven slides or more (because these larger orders would have to be split in separate boxes anyway). If your order is for five or six slides then we have to wait a few days until we hear back from UPS.

campaign.story:
Do You Realize How Much? is an engaging and fun card game that deals with a subject that we are passionate about and believe is important: OUR HUMAN FOOTPRINT. In other words, how much we consume, how much we generate and how much time we spend on our different daily activities in the course of our lives. In short, all those little big details that define us as one of the most peculiar species on the planet, among all the particularly strange species that exist.
If you have ever wondered which is the footprint you leave on the planet simply by existing, this game may bring you some answers, while also providing you with some good laughs with your friends and family.
If you are familiar with our previous projects, you may know that we are a publishing house which specializes in flipbooks, so we couldn't help including a fun little flipbook feature into the card deck. To discover the animation that we have hidden for your entertainment, you just have to arrange the cards in the right order, slide your finger as if it were a flipbook and that's it! Magic Flipboku style! :)
The animated sequence was created by our great friend and incomparable animator Nacho Rodriguez. An animation genius with a hypnotic and organic style. The sequence is also in a loop, so it doesn't matter when you start turning pages, in the end it will work as long as you keep the cards in the correct numerical order. The sequence is based on a continuous transformation of elements from different illustrations that you will find in the cards. A real treat for the eyes and thumb. 👍
It's very easy. The player in charge of asking the question in each round takes the first card from the deck, chooses one of the two questions and reads it out loud. Then, he/she and the rest of the participants have 1 minute to write down their answer. When the time is up, each player reveals his/her bet. The person in charge of that round reads the answer on the back of the card, and the player with the closest number to the correct answer, wins.
Obviously, you will sometimes be way off track with your guess, but what is better than laughing at yourself (except of course laughing at others :D). There are detailed instructions offering variations of the game and score, although the objective is always  the same: to come nearest to the correct value to win each round.
To allow as many humans as possible to play, Do You Realize How Much? will be available in 3 languages: English, Spanish and German. You will be able to choose the version you want after the campaign, when leaving us your shipping details in our pledge manager.
We do not rule out developing possible future editions in other languages, as this would allow us to reach even more humans. :)
We affectionately call them Human Zero. They are the result of a match between a man and a woman, inhabiting a developed Western country with a life expectancy of 79 years. All numbers correspond to an average of this Human Zero, the Frankenstein of Do You Realize How Much?.
Since humans are not the center of the universe (or at least shouldn't be), we have designed 2 more fabulous extension packs that can be perfectly combined with the Human Edition: The Animal Edition and the Space Edition. Each edition contains 200 more questions and answers: together the 3 editions make 600 questions and answers - a real number madness!
The ANIMAL EDITION includes 200 questions and answers from the animal world, all kinds of interesting data, incredible facts and extraordinary curiosities, in short, everything the amazing world of the animal kingdom has to offer.
If you are a space lover or would like to know more about its incredible mysteries and dimensions, then this is for you. The SPACE EDITION is all about spaceflight, rockets, galaxies, moons and stars, planets and the amazing facts and conditions with which man went to the Moon for the very first time.
Both the Animal Edition and the Space Edition are not only fun and entertaining but also very informative and great learning tools for both, adults and kids (recommended minimum age is 12 years).
All the numbers that you will discover in this game are the result of the investigation and research of multiple sources, which were reviewed, compared and processed until we reached the most accurate result possible. Therefore they are approximations or averages based on statistical data. They do not represent an absolute truth, they are figures that reflect the footprint of an average human (the Human Zero exposed above) and obviously can vary over time (hopefully they will change for the better).

Each answer is complemented with additional information such as an equivalence, fun facts, shocking revelations or comparisons that help you visualize the magnitude of the numbers in our human footprint and their impact on the planet.
Through this comparison, the number, which at first is merely abstract, takes on another meaning and we can picture the distance in our minds since we have a reference to compare it with.
 As we know that not all countries use the same units of measurement, to facilitate the understanding of the game and avoid you having to make tedious conversions, all the answers are expressed in the two most important units of measurement: pound-kilograms, inches-centimeters, yards-meters, miles-kilometers, gallons-liters, etc. 
You are right! Indeed, the pair of humans featured in the illustrations are the same ones that were etched into a metal plate and launched into space in the early 1970s on Pioneer probes 10 and 11. The idea was that if the ship was intercepted by extraterrestrial intelligent life, they would be able to decipher where the artifact came from and which creatures sent it - our first business card sent into space!
48 years later we are looking for the same thing, but instead of wanting to be discovered by aliens we are hoping to rediscover ourselves! And what better than to have the fearless couple of the Pioneer probes as reference models in this journey of discovery of our own human footprint.
Good design and packaging are always of great importance in our projects. So we have developed an attractive and handy box that, apart from helping you to arrange the cards while you play, will protect them when you take the game on the road.
All three editions include 100 cards each, featuring two questions and answers as well as two unique illustrations per card. Each card has a small number in the upper left corner. More about that in the next chapter ;)
Our fascination with the human footprint goes back years, and we have always had  the idea of making these breathtaking numbers visible through different formats. Over time we have come to the conclusion that the best way to do this is through a card game. A unique card game that will make you think, take a wild guess, discover, imagine, estimate, laugh, reflect, marvel at and become aware of the astonishing numbers that our nature and human footprint reveal!

In addition to having a great time with friends or family, our ultimate goal is to help raise awareness of our human footprint. And who knows, maybe push you to modify some consumption habits, make better decisions and thus become better and more sustainable human beings. And if we are lucky, contribute a tiny little bit to building a better planet for future generations, because the way we are going, we will clearly not get very far.

A card game is an excellent learning tool; it’s portable, handy and in this case, it’s a game with very simple rules that does not require any complex instructions.


Shipping will be charged AFTER THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN, during the “Pledge Manager” stage.
Below, you will find an estimation of shipping costs per shipping area. These are only estimates, however we are committed to these prices being the maximum amount you will have to pay. All shipments will include tracking.
ADDITIONAL COPIES: All cards and flipbook editions will be available as Add-Ons in our pledge manager, after the campaign. For each additional copy there is a 2€ shipping fee, for smaller flipbooks like Molecularis or Blanko that you might like to add to your pledge, the shipping fee is 1€.
Flipboku is a publishing house located on the beautiful island of Mallorca, specializing in one-of-a-kind flipbooks. The project is the brainchild of animator and designer Jossie Malis and film music composer Julie Reier. We have both been working in the world of animation for many years now and love all things related to animation, books and design. We loved the idea of having our own flipbook publishing house, so we started the project in 2016 and it has grown steadily since then.
The Flipboku team is completed with our illustrators and graphic designers Noemi Aiolo and Erika Godino, besides our irreplaceable production team lead by Gustavo, Tomás and José Ramón. Our last addition to the team is Ricardo Espinosa, writer, old friend and collaborator in the development of this game project. We also thank Nacho Rodríguez, Andy Bernstein, Victoria Amengual and Matías Arévalo for their continuos support!
This is our 4th Kickstarter campaign with Flipboku, and we have successfully completed 3 more with our studio Zumbakamera, so you could say we are already Kickstarter veterans. Crowdfunding allows us to finance the production of our publications in advance - which is a huge advantage for us. Kickstarter is also a great platform to reach more people all over the world and to make our project known internationally. Not only have we been able to make our dream a reality, but we have also gained a loyal and growing community that has been supporting us over the last few years. We think this is the best gift you could ever imagine.

Do You Realize How Much? is our first card game after having published 10 flipbook editions, however the goal is the same: to create unique formats that are not only fun, but also useful whether in a creative, artistic or educational way. To learn more about our flipbooks, check out our website www.flipboku.com or our previous Kickstarter campaigns: Molecularis, Apollo 11 and Dots & Lines.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After 3 successful Kickstarter projects, we have optimized our workflow to ensure that both production and shipping run smoothly. The most important lesson we learned from our first project is that no matter how well prepared you are, you will always have to reckon with unexpected situations as long as you are dependent on third-party providers. This is why we set up our own printing workshop, and 100% of all the production process is now carried out there. Our experienced printing technicians will personally take care of the printing process to ensure that production is executed to perfection, so that all our backers receive a product of the highest possible quality and as quickly as possible.

We are familiar with the risks of shipping in times of Covid-19, since we have fulfilled our last campaign during the pandemic and had to deal with unforeseen events. There may be critical decisions we need to make moving forward that we did not foresee or that we cannot control, however you will be the first to know about all relevant details, through regular updates and clear communication.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers!
This is a brief reminder to let you know that our latest campaign "The Pioneers - A Cinemagic Flip Book Collection" is 24 hours away from ending. If you have not seen it yet, we invite you to discover it here.
As always, it would be a great honor to count on your support! ❤️

Hi everyone,
We have great news for you today!
After several weeks of printing labels and packing boxes, we have finally shipped all your "Do You Realize How Much?" games. By now, all of you should have received a shipping notification with your tracking number. If you haven't, it is probably because your survey is still incomplete, in this case please go to your Crowdox email and check if you have completed your survey and given us your address. 
If you live in Mallorca and have marked the option to pick up your game at our workshop, you are welcome to stop by whenever it suits you, we're there from Monday to Friday, 8 am to 3 pm. You will, however, receive an email in the next days with the exact address and further details.

Hey everybody,
This is a very quick update with some good news!
We have finally received the supply of the boxes and are now ready to start shipping.  We are already starting to pack the individual packages for all of you but decided to wait one more day to print the shipping labels, in case some of you still have to change your shipping address. 
IMPORTANT! SHIPPING ADDRESSES!

Dear backers!
This is just a quick update on the production status and our progress.
We have had an unexpected delay with the arrival of the boxes that our supplier has sent several weeks ago, there has been a mixup on behalf of the carrier, but we have been able to track it down and the shipment is now on its way to us. The good news is, since the majority of the cards are now ready, we can start shipping immediately once the boxes arrive.

Dear backers,
It's been a while since our last update and while we're sorry to keep you waiting for news, it's actually a good sign because it shows that we've been very very busy. 
As we already told you in our previous update, the development of the game ended up being a lot more work than we first anticipated, mostly due to the elaboration of the 600 questions and answers of the three editions of the game.

Dear backers,

First of all, we wish you a happy 2021 and we really hope that this one will turn out to be better than the last one.
The production of the game is going strong! We have taken only a couple of days off over the holidays but we keep on working from our homes, even including more people that are helping with the translation and proofreading of the 600 questions and answers (quite a few!). The questions and answers of the HUMAN and ANIMAL EDITION are already finished and are being reviewed by our proofreaders while we continue to develop the ones for the SPACE EDITION.

Dear backers,
Here we are again with some good news! 
We have finished the survey setup and are now ready to send them out. Please answer the surveys as quickly as possible! That way we will know how many copies we will need of every language and can optimize our production times which means that you will receive your rewards earlier.

Surveys are on their way!

campaign.story:
Hi there! We're Misen.
We design and make premium kitchen tools at fair prices. To preorder our Dutch Oven and make it a reality, click Back This Project. Or read on!
All backers receive 7qt Dutch Oven base and their choice of grill OR traditional lid.
 The Misen Dutch Oven offers premium durability, updated features, and superior cooking — at a reasonable price. 
The dutch oven is a workhorse. It can sauté, sear, boil, fry, bake, and braise, from the stove, to the oven, to the table.
Unfortunately, premium dutch ovens that last a lifetime are insanely expensive and overpriced. And cheaper, low-quality ones are prone to chipping and scratches — making them useless in just a few years.
We think there should be a better option. Premium quality and durability that will last forever, but sold for a fair and honest price.
High-End Protection Against Chipping & Cracking
We used 4 layers of FERRO enamel (the strongest enamel available) to prevent chipping, scratching, and cracking. It’s the luxury brands’ secret to life-long reliability.
Cheaper brands have hand-dipped enamel, creating uneven coatings that crack and chip more easily. Our modern spray application ensures an even coat that’s consistent down to 0.02 mm. Zero imperfections make for a lifetime of toughness.
4-layer FERRO enamel system prevents chipping.
Superior Durability: The Ball Drop Test 
We dropped a 2 lb. metal ball from a 3 ft. height into each dutch oven to simulate metallic impact.
We wanted to make sure that our dutch oven was the most durable on the market, so we put it to the test.
We dropped a 2-pound steel ball from 3 feet in the air to simulate the dutch oven owner’s worst nightmare: a hard metallic impact. Cheap dutch ovens chipped and flaked almost immediately. But drop after drop, Misen's enamel coating remained chip-free and outlasted the competitors. Including the most expensive ones.
Our enamel outperformed the cheap brands, and matched or exceeded the expensive brands.
Grill Lid Makes This Dutch Oven Even More Versatile
Dutch ovens can already do almost anything in the kitchen. We wanted to make ours even more versatile.
So we designed a grill top lid that provides the same tight seal as our traditional lid, but can also be used alone as an indoor grill. The same premium cast iron and enamel layers help create a nearly-nonstick grilling experience and perfect browning.
If you prefer the traditional knob-style lid, don't worry — we offer those too.
Extra Versatility and Protection
This added silicone lid creates an airtight seal on your Misen Dutch Oven — handy if you’re using the grill top lid and base at the same time. It’s highly durable, PFOA-free, oven-safe, and made from platinum-grade silicone.
Plus, it stacks neatly between the lid and base when you’re storing them away. 
Premium durability, at a fraction of the price.
We don't think you should have to choose between wildly expensive “premium” pieces and the lower-quality cheap dutch ovens.
Luxury brands are durable, but carry unnecessarily high price tags thanks to clever branding. By working closely with our factories and selling directly to you, we're able to offer the same quality (or better!) at a much more reasonable price.
Our goal was simple. Create the most durable dutch oven possible, and sell it for a price that’s fair and affordable.
 Nearly Nonstick, Zero Maintenance Needed, Dishwasher Safe 
Our enamel is smooth enough to be nearly nonstick without any maintenance.
Most messes just need a gentle soak and scrub to wipe away. Our dutch oven is also dishwasher-safe (though we’d prefer you hand-wash)!
Thoughtful design updates to a classic piece make this dutch oven even easier to use at home
 The Millimeters Matter 
We spent over 18 months researching and developing the Misen Dutch Oven. We asked questions and received tons of feedback from our community on what they liked (and didn’t like) about these pieces.
We didn’t want to reinvent the wheel. Dutch ovens are already amazing cookware pieces, but we found a few small ways we could update the traditional design for an even better cooking experience.
Finally, we’ve got something we’re proud of. Design and tooling are complete, and we’re ready to go into production. But we need your help to make it happen!

campaign.story:
Once upon a time, decades before Charlie Chaplin & Buster Keaton were projected onto the silver screen, William Horner was making movies on a much smaller scale. 
It's a cylinder with equally spaced slits cut around the circumference. Inside, there's a printed strip of paper with an equal number of images in sequential order. As you spin the zoetrope and look through the slits, they act like a camera shutter, or a strobe, causing the images to flicker and come to life with a phenomenon known as "persistence of vision." The animated strips are easily swapped out for other strips, like going through animated gifs on instagram or twitter.
It's the physical interaction of early cinema devices like these, (the analog in a digital world) that makes people smile and connect to them. My artwork ( artnofood.com ) has turned flipbooks into sculptures, brought the mutoscope out of it's clamshell and even added gears to the phénakisticope (hard to say, but oh so much fun to play with). I love it when my work takes a simple gesture, design, or even a story, and presents them in new/old ways. And then I started to look at what I could do with a zoetrope... 
This lamp is called "SpermatoZoëtrope." It will also be available in baby blue.
For my updated version of the Zoëtrope I wanted to honor the original concept: a hand powered animation device with changeable art. First I replaced the slits with some invisible tech such as LED's, magnets, custom electronics... That allowed me to put the art on the outside and light the Zoëtrope from within (lamp). And with more room, came more frames – hundreds of frames. Now, armed with a larger canvas and more frames, the fun was just starting. 
I soon discovered new ways to create animations that are linear, cyclical, up, down, backwards, forwards, and sometimes all at once. I look at each Zoëtrope Lamp like a short, recuring film. I have so many ideas that I can't wait to bring to life. All that's needed is a simple twist and suddenly, it’s more than just a beautiful lamp. It’s an animated work of pre-cinema art.
And, while not really needed, I added an umlaut above the “e” in Zoëtrope. My niece, Zoë, also has an umlaut.
What will the funding be used for? 
Funds raised will be used to produce all the custom electronics, the tops, the bottoms, the specialty printing, and all the other parts needed to bring these Zoëtrope Lamps into the world. 
THE TIMELINE
 September - Launch Kickstarter.
 October - Campaign ends.
 November - Ship Flipbooks. Ship Phénakisticope.
 November - January - Manufacturing, printing, assembling and, packaging of the Zoëtrope Lamps. 
 February - Ship the Zoëtropes. The spinning begins.
Please note: The hope is to ship sooner, and we will if we can. Just wanted to give more time for any possible Covid related delays. 
 AND NOW, THE REWARDS: 
This the phénakisticope in action  
PLAY


I like to use friends as models. That's Kent murdering Annabelle 10 minutes after they met. No worries, she’s fine, the knife was cardboard covered in aluminum foil. Besides, Kent's a really nice guy and wouldn't hurt a fly. Maker's fun fact, I shot my model friends on a green screen so I could change the apartments behind them. But Kent was stabbing so fast it was difficult to silhouette the arm with the knife, and it was my favorite take of the "murder" My solution? A mostly green abstract painting on the wall, no need to silhouette.  
Behold the Spinning Magrittes. That's Cheng by the window and in the sky. George on the bottom and near the roof. And that's me as the littlest Magrittes.
This is Sloane Rocking in Slow-Mo. Video by her dad Dan. (Try following one column as it rises.)
 WHY 2 LAMPS?  
So you can share the magic that we create together. Most of the work, from editing to the design of the Zoëtrope Lamp Shade goes into creating the first one. Why should one set of grandparents get a lamp when the other set is just as worthy? 
Pongo thinks this is a great idea. FYI: There is over 201 Dalmatians on this lamp.

MAGNET POWER!!! (A goal of $25,000)
In keeping with the original hand spun way of the Zoëtrope, I chose not to motorize this lamp*. The thought was to keep it simple and not have a constantly animated object. To create a cool object with a secret. By spinning it with your hand, you become a part of the action, as it becomes an "event" rather than a constant display of animation.
With a good spin, the Zoëtrope lamp can spin for several minutes until it stops and becomes a just a good looking lamp again. I want to add a magnetic assist that would keep it spinning for up to 10 minutes with just a slight twist of the lamp.
*In the future, as I make larger Zoëtropes, I will be adding motors and/or hand cranked gears.
Prototypes, experiments, behind the scenes
the abduction cow during a break in filming
While it's nessecerry to show how my Zoëtropes Lamps spin in real life. Filming them creates rolling black bars and excessive flickering. It's an issue with syncing the Zoëtrope "shutter speed" to the camera film speed. So, I tried stop motion animation to film some tests. I turned each lamp 24x while stopping to take a photo at every 15 degree turn. 
Here are some tests, they are not for sale yet. I would need a license to sell these.  But, I look forward to talking to the fine folks at Disney, Pokemon, Warner, Sony, NFL, NBA, MLB, MTV, the Olympics. Reach out to hear more about ideas for content, how to bring them to life and would love to talk to someone about a license deal or two.
PLAY

Here's a Bruce Lee test. I called it Many Chucks
This is what what Mr Lee looks like when this is animated.

This is animation from a test I call Kane Klaps

The Nuzzle pillow was created by a team of entrepreneurs with experience in the home goods industry looking for a better way to sleep. Our team tried and tested every pillow style and innovation on the market; however, nothing felt right.
Being the kind of people who don’t settle for less than the best, we decided to make our pillow instead. To achieve this, we partnered with one of the world’s best startup incubators (Accelerator Center) to leverage their experience in product design & development, manufacturing, and supply chain management to bring the most cutting edge textile technology and the latest sleep-based research.
The result was the Nuzzle pillow, and we think you’ll agree that it’s pretty special. We’re thrilled to be bringing Nuzzle to life for you, and we can’t thank you enough for being a part of our journey.
This project's logistics plan has passed thorough a 7-point review, and Floship certifies that we have an efficient and reliable logistics plan to deliver this good from the factory to you, the customers.

Our earliest prototype was created with memory foam. Similar to our final design, the two outer halves would zip open then there were two foam layers in between. However, after initial testing with beta users, we quickly realized that memory foam was not the answer!
The image above shows some of the outer layers we have sampled over the past 2 years. Everything from feather/down blends, shredded foam, alternative down, feather, and different microfibers, etc. Furthermore, we have tested various shell materials too: Polyester, cotton, poly/cotton blends, rayon from bamboo, cotton/phase change material, cotton with silver infusion, etc.
The image above shows some of our layer samples. We have developed variations with shredded foam, feather, down, down alternative, and different microfibers. One of the most timely objectives in the development phase was finding the optimal fill weight to accommodate various sleep positions and comfort levels. Some of our fill weight samples are shown in the bottom image. We tested approximately 50 different fill weight combinations!

DIMENSIONS
Blocc comes in two sizes: Medium and Large. The dimensions are as shown in the image below. You'll be able to choose the size when we send out the backer survey at the end of the campaign!
REWARDS
ITERATIONS
We devoted all our time and effort developing Blocc over the past four months. Thanks to 3D-printing, we were able to create a number of prototype iterations, conduct extensive product testing, and refine every aspect of the design to ensure comfort, style, and functionality.
HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!
We need your help to spread the word about Blocc. Feel free to use the materials in our press kit. Every post, share, and pledge counts!
OUR STORY : HOW BLOCC WAS BORN
The three wise monkeys using Blocc
Our team is based in South Korea—one of the first countries to be hit hard by the pandemic.
We often noticed people wearing masks and habitually touching their face out in public. After looking into this further, we found that the average person subconsciously touches their face 23 times an hour (source: https://bit.ly/2APII4I) and that this is an innate habit very difficult to break. Therefore, it only seemed logical for us to create a face shield that would block (hence, the product name) the hand from touching the face. We noticed that some people had already been using them, but none of them seemed to look comfortable or well-designed. This is why we decided to make one ourselves—one designed for the average person to wear in public without feeling embarrassed or uncomfortable.
Our sincere hope is that Blocc will help you become wary of your face-touching habit. With your help, we can make Blocc a reality.

The Sustainable Summit Shoes by &Collar
LOOK GOOD / FEEL GOOD / DO GOOD
Summit Performance Dress Shoe Features
After several successful Kickstarter campaigns and after successfully shipping over 35,000+ items on our website, we are excited to announce the SUSTAINABLE SUMMIT SHOE by &Collar .
THE BEST WORK SHOE EVER. 
We designed the Summit Shoe to be the most flexible shoe in every way. We didn't just design it to move flexibly, we designed it to be used anywhere. It's dressy enough for work but comfortable enough for travel or play.  
Flexible/Comfortable Sole
We work and live on our feet. Even working at stand-up desks makes us more aware of our feet than ever. But not everyone can wear sneakers to the office. So we thought, what if we make a work shoe that was designed for the type of work we do. So we made a list. It had to be: 
LIGHTWEIGHT
BREATHABLE
MACHINE WASHABLE
and above all else
COMFORTABLE
And while we were at it, we thought we'd try to make a shoe that would be good for the Earth too. 
Interested? 
Breathable
Your beautiful leather shoes don't breathe, 
and that STINKS (literally). 
The key to cool feet that don't stink are shoes that breathe. We designed the SUMMIT SHOES with a high-performance breathable mesh fabric. In fact, our whole clothing line is based on a stretchy, breathable fabric with a SECRET. 
 OUR SECRET: Water bottles. 
Yup, tons of water bottles. Americans use roughly 50 BILLION water bottles every year and only recycle about 23%. We want to make something that's not just useful, but AMAZING out of that recycled plastic.  
Oxford Wingtip Design (to look like a dress shoe!)
 WASH THIS WAY

Machine Washable

Our lightweight shoes are lighter than leather and more breathable than wool. We are releasing our first shoes in the most needed colors for work: black and brown.
Ultra-lightweight
  We KNOW where you walked last summer. 
You may forget about comfort for a few steps when you are trying on shoes, but we don't. And your feet never forget an uncomfortable shoe. That's why we use customized memory foam insoles that make the SUMMIT SHOES comfier than your mattress. Trust us, your feet will thank you. 
Comfort of a running shoe
 Do you know what else is a pain? 
Untying your shoes at the end of the day is a real downer. Our stretchy shoes can be pulled on and off. We started as a shirt company, but our stretchy shoe collars stay true to our &Collar name. 
Stretch Collar
Yup, we thought of everything. 
The perfect shoe for work and for play.  We just need your help to make it a reality.

Long-lasting design
We have designed our products to last years by using sustainable, high-quality materials. We pay approximately 25% more than we would otherwise to use sustainable materials that we know are of the highest quality. If a product breaks down, we as a company take it back, inspect it, and then repurpose and reuse it.
Reusability and recyclability
Packaging to date has been 100% recyclable, recycled, and reusable. We are working on making all future materials and packaging to be compostable as well!
Sustainable materials
We are using recycled plastic bottles to create the threads/materials we are using in the uppers of our shoes. This is in line with the 15-20 plastic bottles we use in all of our products that we previously launched on Kickstarter and that we are continuing to sell today on our website.
Environmentally friendly factories
All of our factories are certified by various independent third-party groups. We are planning on working with the factory on a carbon emission buyback program where we pay extra to offset our carbon emissions.

campaign.story:
The Groove Belt™ is perfect for:
Sitting at a desk
Racing through the Alaskan bush, being chased by a grizzly
Grilling hot dogs on the Traeger you got for Father’s Day
Beasting your next free-climb
Rapid response when nature or love calls
Bending down to pick up every #$*% kid’s toy
What makes the Groove Belt™ so awesome?
Snap-Tech™
The correct term is ne·o·dym·i·um magnets. Yeah...they’re awesome, even if you can’t pronounce it. The magnet snaps the buckle in perfect place...oh and you can unlatch with one hand.. Just listen to that SNAP. If you have an ASMR fetish, try to hold it together. These bad boys snap and latch instantly. Honestly, latching your belt is now more addictive than Joe Exotic’s tiger meth.   
PLAY

Stretch-Tech™ (aka just the right amount of stretch)
You know the deal. Your belt is either too tight or too loose (neither is a good situation). The Groove Belt™ is comfier than the sweatpants you wore for 3 weeks during the Corona Pandemic.  These bad boys have just the right amount of stretch to keep you feeling comfortable and flexible.   
PLAY

Secure-Tech™
Set it and forget it design. Once you adjust the belt to the proper length, never worry about it again. Unless you go really crazy next Thanksgiving, just use our easy adjust to give yourself a little extra. 
Stiff-Tech™ (aka won’t fold in your belt loops)
You know that belt you bought last time? The one that folds over at the back of your pants? The Groove Belt™ doesn’t. Whether you’re climbing Mount Everest, attaching your tactical gear, or just grilling hotdogs in your backyard (let’s be honest, the most likely), this belt is made with the perfect blend of durable, stiff webbing and stretch. It’s going to stay on you like that bad tattoo from your last bro-country concert, without losing its form. 
Space-Tech™
Made from recycled space shuttle cladding...Okay maybe not but we used the best materials on earth to make this the best belt EVER. Between our proprietary webbing, rare-earth neodymium magnets and A380 aluminum alloy buckle, you’re basically ready for an apocalypse. Or for simply pulling up your pants an average of 5.24x per day.  
PLAY

Won't flap and get all loosey-goosey Tech™
No one likes the end of a belt flapping around all loosey-goosey (please put that away.) That’s why we designed the end to neatly tuck behind the belt. For the occasional rogue fly-away, we’ve added our secure keeper loop. No more flap. 
94-Year Warranty
Yep! Just like our rings and watch bands, this belt is covered with a lifetime guarantee. So if you break it, you’re good for a return free of charge for life (unless you make it past 94 years from now, but let’s be honest—your diet is not up to par for that).  



Just in case you thought we threw this together over the weekend... here’s a glimpse into the last 12 months. 


If everything else didn't convince you to back the Groove Belt™ maybe some photos of this sexy, beast of a belt below will seal the deal. 
Almost as sexy as the Groove Belt™ are our amazing ads. Here is one for your viewing pleasure

Risks and challenges
So far we've been able to deliver our past two Kickstarter projects on time but they weren’t without snags and we've learned a lot! Our manufacturing partners are extremely experienced and we’ve been working with them for several years. We have multiple factories to give us alternative sources and our supply chains are well-tested. However, there's always a risk when building a new product.

The Coronavirus is something we're also watching very closely. We manufacture our components in Asia and assemble here in the states. Our factories are all back up and running and we are ordering all our materials in advance.

We've launched many product lines over the last few years and manufactured and delivered hundreds of thousands of products. We have an experienced product development team to ensure quality and to keep us on our timeline. We will do everything possible to make sure we delivered backer rewards promptly.

Of course, through the entire campaign, we'll be very transparent about what's going on so you can confidently back this project!

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Materials: Throughout development, we have focused on finding the highest quality, premium materials and finishes. From the buckles to the webbing, we have been through multiple rounds of selecting, testing, and refining.

Stress testing: We have thoroughly tested our belts. They kick ass and stand up to almost anything.
Reusability and recyclability
With our No BS Lifetime Warranty, we expect our belts to get years of use. We put a lot of thought into how we design our packaging experience in the hope that you enjoy it enough to keep it or reuse it! It would be cost prohibitive and impractical to make every piece of our packaging from recycled content, however we do everything we can to reduce the use of single-use plastics and to avoid the ‘throw-away’ design of much packaging used by other companies.
Sustainable Distribution
As we assemble and fulfill all our product right here in Tennessee we are able to efficiently work with a small footprint. Our warehouse and production areas are efficiently laid out. We use reusable, large format bins and large capacity bags to transfer packages to our shipping partners.
