campaign.story:
The V3 Blaze Wallet by Valmor Design is completely custom-designed for busy modern-day professionals on the go. Lose the weight of your thick wallet but never compromise on performance. With a few specialized pockets and cutting-edge technology, you have everything you need and more.   
You’ve been telling us what you want, and our development team has been working hard every day to make it real. And now we bring you Blaze Wallet evolved form, the Strapo Wallet. With it, our new company name, Valmor Design.
With The Blaze Wallet, We Invite You To Be A Part Of Our Story Again
The story of the Blaze Wallet is a story of doing more with less -- of having a wallet that is sleek and thin but does just as much or more than a regular wallet.
Our designers have pulled out all the stops to create something we dare to call revolutionary in wallet design.
Gone are the days where you have to carry around a thick, fat brick of a wallet that bulges and makes you “sit crooked” all day.
Also gone are the days when a minimalist wallet is nothing more than a glorified money clip. We’ve invented a wallet that truly does allow you to do more with less.
Walk away from tradition and join the Valmor Design movement with your Blaze Wallet today!
Crafted from classic top-grain leather that will patina beautifully -- each crease, nick, and mark burnishing it with one-of-a-kind highlights showing every step of your journey.
Crafted from premium top-grain leather that will patina beautifully
2 cards in front pockets
Central pocket that holds 3-4 cards, which is RFID protected
Pull tab strap to easily access cards
Highly durable elastic band stores up to 3-4 cards
Drop-free coin pocket
Lanyard loop/keyring attachment
GPS tracker pocket
Built-in NFC
RFID protection
Work ID or transit card easy scanning slot
Slim, low-profile design
Eco-friendly packaging
David vs Goliaths
The day was October 4th, 2017 - the evening before our first Kickstarter launch. We were done with all the work leading up to this big moment… and we were all super NERVOUS.
At that time we were going up against some of the biggest names in wallet design with huge corporate backing. From all appearances, we didn’t stand a chance of becoming successful.
Our Miracle -- The Underdogs’ Comeback
Towards the end of October, something amazing started to happen. Our Kickstarter got picked up by one big media outlet, and then we got picked up by another, and then another. Lifehacker, Kotaku, Gizmodo, and many more!
By the end of our campaign, we were over 7,000% funded. We had a big celebration the night after our Kickstarter.
And all throughout 2018, while we were fulfilling orders -- emails were pouring in from people about the direction we should go next. Along the way, we learned some very important lessons.
 How we created Blaze Wallet 
 Founded on a Dream and Passion alone 
In the past 2 years, our company has been growing immensely and we were able to ship to 65 Countries. With the STRAPO wallet, it was always our mission to revolutionize ordinary purchases by providing extraordinary value.
In the midst of evolving our company, we wanted a name that clearly communicates our brand values. That’s the reason why we chose the name VALMOR DESIGN for ourselves. It combines the words “Value” and “More” and represents the marriage of so-called “ordinary” products with a new standard of practical usefulness.
If you rewind our story all the way to the beginning, you’ll see us making our first wallet prototypes out of duct tape. 
Shipping: We are ready for production, As planned our first batch rewards will be shipped by the end of May 2020. We will ship V3 Minimalist Wallet to our backers worldwide. The shipping cost varies base on your location. You can find out the shipping cost in each pledge. However, there may be additional duties and taxes you might have to pay. In any case, we recommend checking your country’s tax and customs laws. If we reship your package, the backer has to pay for the new shipping.
Return/Refund: While all of our products have a 1-year warranty, we do not offer refunds, returns, or exchanges on items received as Kickstarter rewards. The support we get from our Kickstarter backers is what enables us to run and grow our business, gather customer feedback, design new products and improve existing ones. In the Kickstarter community, the items that you receive after making a pledge are referred to as "rewards" because they are not purchases in the traditional sense. Think of rewards as gifts.
WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET
As a small business, it’s often very difficult to secure enough capital for larger projects, especially one that requires such quality materials and craftsmanship. We’ve turned to crowdfunding to help keep costs as low as possible, removing the strain of investor returns which would send the cost of the product higher. Once our funding goal is reached, we will be able to carry out our first production run, fulfilling the preorders made here. Please see our reward tier to secure yours today. It would also make a wonderful gift.

campaign.story:
The Anxious Taxidermist is a quirky, off-kilter musical series written & created by Aurora Florence and Jeff Dickamore of Saint Norma Jean Productions, & co-produced with Katie & Jacob Schwarz of Mystery Box. The story follows Marie, a young woman who uses her secret passion for taxidermy to cope with debilitating anxiety.  
 Not just any anxiety--but the kind that can really knock you flat. In portraying characters with these issues, we are hoping to reduce the stigma around mental health and get people thinking and talking more about it. To start some conversations. We are also aiming to use the musical elements of the show to help us all better understand what it's like to live with anxiety. We have done our best to be careful in doing so--consulting with two fantastic therapists: Tony Overbay (check out his podcast "The Virtual Couch") and Paul Peterson.
 And not just any taxidermy--but an art form that uses only found animals (the kind you find on the side of the road) and antiques (the kind you find at a garage sale). If you're curiosity is piqued, Google "Rogue Taxidermy." It's a whole artistic movement we stumbled upon last fall. We've since collaborated and consulted with two artists, Hollie Dilley & Jillian Abernathy, for two commissioned pieces for the pilot episode. 
*No squirrels were harmed in the making of this pilot.
**But two were scavenged off the highway. 
Through the combined efforts of an incredible team (see list below), plus some extra help from friends and family, we wrapped production of the twenty-minute pilot episode on September 20. The footage looks incredible, the three studio recorded songs sound amazing, but we need your help to finish things up and spread the word! 
 Our goal with this Kickstarter campaign is to cover:
 $1500 in construction materials 
$2500 to cover post-production costs--everything that will make the final film look and sound amazing
$500 to cover the rewards 
Anything beyond that will go towards festival submissions & additional recording for the score. 
 Long term, our goal is to build an audience & support system that will allow us to carry the story beyond the initial pilot episode. 
THANK YOU for contributing to The Anxious Taxidermist in whatever way you can! Every dollar & every share not only helps, but means the world to us.
Much Love,
Jeff & Aurora 
 ***Note: If you're as excited about The Anxious Taxidermist as we are, & want to contribute more to the success of the project, please contact us directly so that we can discuss an executive producer situation.***
THE TEAM
The Anxious Taxidermist is a collaborative effort with a long, and not wholly comprehensive list of stellar people, in no particular order: Katie Schwarz (producer), Jeff Dickamore (director/writer), Aurora Florence (music/writer), Jake Schwarz (DP), Kendra Lowe (music producer), Garret Breeze (orchestrations), Becky Swasey (hair/makeup), Whitney Donald (production design), Mary Lee (art/props), Matt Siemers (1st AD), Alan Seawright (2nd AD), Kade Atwood (Production), Karina Orton (design assistant), Jameson Dressen (1st AC), Stephanie Bogdan (2nd AC), Michael Stone (DIT), Jared Jaynes (Sound), Merik Richardson (gaffer), Jack Lott (grip), Mariah Johnson (grip), Ben Johns (grip), Michael Frazier (Set Cosntruction), Matthew Buckner (construction assist.), Katy Baldwin (Set Decorator), Anna Hawkins (Costumer), LaRee Florence (taxidermy costumer), Truman Florence (BTS, Set Decorator), Brittany Butler (BTS), & last but not least, Alexia Meyer (choreographer). Plus a shout out to Debra Hale, Glenna Ryan, Shelly Iosefa, & Mary Close for  last-minute catering and Becky Stratford for sourcing antique doors and windows!
THE CAST
An incredible group of people both on set and in the recording studio: Aurora Florence, Shaunna Harmon Thompson, Alex Diaz, Rachael Winegar, Pat Barnett Carr, Rich Chavez, Justin Hackworth, Rad Martinez, Beatriz Melo, Mack Seiler, Carolyn Hartvigsen, Kathleen Sheffield, Willard Cron, Madison Bay, Brooklyn Villeneuve, Titus Trimiar, Brittany Butler, Jared Olsen, Jared Wells, Kristen Metzger, Sunny & Hannah Whiting, Adeline & Truman Florence, & Paul, Melanie, Rachel, & Alice Cartwright.

campaign.story:
THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING JOURNEY!
For any support/business/press inquiries, please reach out to support@poweruptoys.com
POWERUP 4.0 is the smartest, most intuitive paper plane kit we’ve ever made. It makes it possible to fly with ease and smoothness in a variety of conditions. 
Say goodbye to nosedives and choppy flights. We’ve added a new on-board flight computer and 2 new sensors: gyro and accelerometer, combined with 2 thrust vectoring motors. That means flying POWERUP 4.0 is smoother than ever, and can now do all this:

That’s right. POWERUP 4.0 can auto-loop. So you can master tricks and awesome aerobatics by simply pressing a button.


We’ve added 2 high speed motors to POWERUP 4.0. That means you’ve got double the thrust, additional maneuvering possibilities, and sharper turns. 

And together with the flight assist, you can fly just about anything

Now you can learn to fly like a pro. We’re showing you real-time analytics including heading direction, thrust level and turning angles.




We’ve made it a lot easier and way cooler to fly POWERUP 4.0 at night. Optional LED lights will enable you to light up the night - making for awesome visuals and round-the-clock fun.


2 rear wheels and 1 front wheel give your paper plane more style and make for easier takeoff and landing. They also make it possible to launch off of a surface rather than hand-launching. 



We partnered with the best RC hobby vloggers on the planet – FliteTest! They have put together their incredibly creative minds to develop a foam jet inspired by the F22 for the 4.0. It is made from a special laser cut foam board they created and make in the USA.


Intuitive control makes it easy to fly. Simply tilt your phone in the direction you want your plane to fly. It’s really that easy.




Thanks to 3 super successful Kickstarter campaigns,400K+ happy customers, and more than $3.5 million in funding, we decided to bring you a new and improved paper airplane kit to add to your collection.
Shai Goitein - pilot, industrial designer, CEO and founder - decided it was time to level up again. So we listened to feedback from our POWERUP 3.0, POWERUP FPV and POWERUP Dart users, and made this the most powerful, most intuitive, and overall best version yet. Our brand new Autopilot Assist feature makes every flight a smooth one-- even in bad conditions. Real-time analytics help you become a better pilot, and two high speed motors mean you can get super creative with your plane designs. We’ve even added optional LED lights so you can fly at night.
POWERUP 4.0 is breaking paper plane barriers, and we’re excited to share this badass edition with you all.
POWERUP is an incredibly helpful tool when it comes to teaching and learning aeronautics. Students can test multiple designs, analyze their work and improve their planes. Through trial and error, they can understand what makes their plane fly smoother, longer and farther- key lessons in airplane design.  












Tross is a data driven Crowdfunding company

updates.update_content: We did it!

Hey Backers!
Today we have a short update for you.
Shipping update
While thousands of POWERUP 4.0 are landing world wide, we are eagerly waiting to resume the second wave of shipping to the rest of the backers. This was all scheduled to start yesterday on the 10th of September, but unfortunately this did not happen :-(. Our freight forwarder just updated us that the container which arrived at the USA customs on August 31 is still stuck in the LA port!  It appears that the combination of Labor day weekend and transit delays on the railroad, have added another week to the schedule. The new ETA is currently September 18th. Let's hope we don't have any more surprises. Once the container arrives we will resume fulfilment which is estimated to spread over 2 weeks. This Is all very disappointing to me, as it is to you, considering the fact that we made such huge strides with production regardless of Covid 19 issues, and the fire at our printer. Backers that their Backerkit order status is "not locked" or "not fulfilled", please be a little more patient. As you can imagine, this is beyond our control.

Hi Backers,
We have a very exciting update for you today. Please sit back and take the time to read through. Trust me, it will be worth your time.
Greetings, backers, we are ready to ship!
Dear Backers

campaign.story:
Welcome to my kickstarter! You and I would not be here today were it not for kimmel’s feature on my project – I would like to thank everyone at ABC for giving me this opportunity. So! The magic recipe that gives rise to this campaign puts a walkie-talkie inside an avocado - this gives us a Guac-e Talk-e! I will be offering the devices themselves as well as t-shirts, stickers and pins all in support of generating enough money to startup device manufacture. Extremely important to note is that the promotional materials I’m using presently were created with a different manufacturing platform in mind – namely creating the avocado enclosures by hand using an acrylic resin system in Guatemala City. This time around however, I will rely on a much more traditional approach. Please follow my project’s progress on instagram @andysguacbar ! Thank you for reading!!
Guac-ing & Goofing
The Guac-e Talk-e - stay connected!
Insect hunting! Perfect for the outdoors
Working on a project - yes, we painted that!
------Product Development------
 From my end I will be collaborating with an organization that has the expertise in retail electronics design and manufacture required to bring this device to life. The search for a partner is still in the exploratory phase, quotes I’ve received vary widely but basically the heart of the matter is that I’m looking for a good teammate to take on this project with. That being said, if you are involved in an organization that would like to work with me please send me a message – we might be a fit. 
-------Radio Specs-------
The radios themselves are your standard license-free two-way radios; you’ve likely used this class of radio going camping with your family or at a theme park. The government has guidelines on antenna power output and frequency allocation for FRS radios so in brief the technical details of this class of radio, albeit with some differences, are similar between one radio and the next.
--------Prototype-------
 The guac-e talk-e prototype is made in two parts. The devices were initially created in Guatemala City using an artisanal, piecewise process. The radios themselves were purchased from a third party and I personally made all the somewhat rustic looking avocado shells. The guac-e’s in the photos serve as proof of concept - what’s clumsy and rustic-looking now needs some hard work and what comes out is an elegant walkie-talkie.
The Guac-e Talk-e Walkie-Talkie

Risks and challenges
We have successfully completed 3 Kickstarter campaigns in the past (all of which were delivered on time).
 
We take the trust of our backers very seriously, and understand that you are only backing us because you expect a quality product in a reasonable amount of time. Before giving delivery dates of any kind, we evaluate the entire process from design, engineering, tooling, testing, production and shipping. The delivery dates we have selected have been carefully evaluated and selected because of their high degree of achievability. 

We've spent the last few months designing and engineering the Rain Straw. We have already chosen our factory and have made two separate trips to their facilities in preparation for full scale production. The factory we have chosen is a reputable factory with a strong track record of delivering quality products on time. 
 
Of course, surprises can happen and not everything can be foreseen ahead of time. Between tooling, sourcing, and logistics, certain processes can delay timelines. With that being said, we are confident that we will once again deliver our products on time. We will keep all of our backers informed of any potential hurdles as they may arise. We've learned a lot from previous Kickstarter campaigns, and we're committed to complete transparency and accountability with our backers.

campaign.story:
Throw Throw Burrito is what you get when you cross a card game with dodgeball. Try to collect matching sets of cards faster than your opponents while simultaneously ducking, dodging, and throwing squishy airborne burritos. The cards you collect earn points, but getting hit by flying burritos loses them. So clear some space and put away the antiques, because you’ve never played a card game quite like this before.
Since we created Exploding Kittens four years ago, we've been making games that bring friends and family together around a table, away from their screens. We brought this game to Kickstarter because we believe that adding a bit of physicality to game night is what comes next.
So, if you're into the idea of party games and weaponized Mexican food, please help us make this game a reality. We think you'll love it as much as we do.
Hugs and missiles,
-Elan, Matt, and the Exploding Kittens Team    
HOW DOES THIS WORK?
No Funding Goals, No Backer Goals, instead we want you to enter the Burrito Bowl! 
Compete in a series of incredible events to test your burrito themed prowess and we’ll upgrade your games for free!
Throw Throw Burrito started when our friend, Brian Spence, pitched a new game idea to us and we immediately fell in love. Over the next eight months, we worked closely with Brian to tune the game, design the cards, and destroy most of the fragile items in our homes.
The game went through many versions.
First, there was the "Mangoes with Animal Heads Phase":
Mango Pug
Then came the flying animal ideas: 
Then fruit: 
Then so many Mexican food ideas:
After finally choosing a name, Matt got to work on the cards: 
Character Exploration
Style Exploration
We wanted to put this project on Kickstarter because it's the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make improvements as a community. We think this game is great, but we need your help making it even better.
So if a world full of weaponized Mexican food is a world you want to live in, please back this project and help us build this game. 
With love and mad strafing skills,
- The Exploding Kittens Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for our team is building the throwables. Since our Exploding Kittens campaign in 2015 (followed by Bears vs Babies, and You've Got Crabs), we've learned a lot about making cards and have shipped over 8 million decks of our games worldwide. But throwables are a new challenge. We're working with the finest toy manufacturers in the world to make sure that we deliver the best materials that are fun to throw (not too light) and don't hurt when they hit you (not too heavy).

It's also very important to us that everyone gets their game on time. We don't want this to be a campaign where you spend the next two years getting fifty emails about production updates and delays. If you back this project, we want you to start throwing burritos at your friends as soon as possible. This is why we're not offering t-shirts or other non-game related reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the game.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Rocketbook Beacons allow you to capture, organize and broadcast important notes, diagrams, and big ideas on any whiteboard or wall surface in real-time. No need for expensive new hardware and software. Just four restickable "beacons" for any sized surface and one futuristic smartphone app that connects with many of the popular cloud services you already use!
Place the four restickable beacon quadra-triangles in each corner of any size whiteboard, and start writing the way you normally would. Then download the free Rocketbook app. When you scan your whiteboard with the app, the space aged machine vision will “see” the Beacons and quickly capture your whiteboard from any angle. 
Rocketbook Beacons can modernize any size whiteboard you have hanging around. If your surface area is small, and every inch of writing space counts, simply cut the beacons to size and the app will still capture your work! The majority of whiteboards (over 3 feet wide or high) will work great without trimming!
The Rocketbook app will instantly adjust and visually enhance your scans so the digital version is light years ahead of the real thing.
The Rocketbook app allows you to assign 7 shortcut symbols to "destinations" in the cloud which could be any folder inside Dropbox, Evernote, Google Docs, your email address, and many other popular services.
Set up the app to instantly beam your notes, diagrams, and big ideas. And save precious time by transcribing your handwriting with powerful optical character recognition (OCR) technology.
For crucial missions with a scattered crew, the app allows you to stream your whiteboard in real-time. Switch to “Broadcast” mode, share the unique URL and get ready to collaborate with your team anywhere in the world. Your private, real-time page is updated every time you scan your whiteboard. Or simply prop your phone facing your whiteboard and set the app to auto-scan every 5 seconds. 
Rocketbook Beacons are made with space aged micro-suction technology that is specially designed to stick to whiteboard surfaces. This synthetic and durable material acts like millions of microscopic suction cups that cling to your whiteboard and won't deteriorate over time like other sticky adhesives.  The beacons can even be cleaned to ensure a quality bond with each use! 
The Rocketbook app can transcribe your handwriting with OCR or “Optical Character Recognition” technology. Transcription allows you to send a digital text version of your whiteboard, or even search through all of your scans with keywords and phrases. You can even auto-name your files by placing two hashtags ‘#’ on either side of a title like ##THIS TITLE##. Traditional surfaces will never be the same! 
For more information on our OCR features, fly over to the Rocketbook Launch page
Customers & Duties Information For International Orders
We cannot mark as gift, this is illegal so we will not be able to do this.
Our prices do not include VAT, GST or other country taxes.
As many of you know, our terms of sale are CIF destination. This means that we pay all freight, but none of the duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Kickstarter.
As many of you know, Canadian Customs are very strict on products imported into Canada. All products over Canadian $25 are subject to duties and GST or Vat tax. Our invoices are in U.S. dollars, and being converted to Canadian dollars for purpose of duties and taxes, by Canadian Customs.
Here's a link to find the CBSA offices where you can actually go and do the clearance, and save some significant dollars:
http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/do-rb/services/lvs-efv-eng.html
This project is promoted by Jellop , the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $250MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth crowdfunding campaign, and experience is everything. We delivered on our very first campaign late, which was painful experience, but we learned a ton. Since then, we've delivered early on every one. We make conservative estimates and get our numbers and partners straight ahead of time.

With that said, like with any project, there is risk in bringing a new product into the world. It is possible that our reliance on supplier and manufacturing vendors could result in unforeseen delays.

Want to get more than one reward? You can do that! See how in our FAQ section! To begin, please watch this very personal message about the sacrifice behind this movement. You will learn things that will surprise you and hopefully inspire you:
     $1,000,000 raised positions us to obtain the remaining $39M needed for FULL FEATURE PRODUCTION. How? Tax incentives and foreign distribution commitments! We can likely make our $40M film raising just $5-$10M privately. $1M puts us closer than you think!!
HELP US REACH $1M BEFORE AUG. 18TH. SEND YOUR FRIENDS TO FUNDREIGN.COM!
Hello Champions of Liberty,
Happy Independence Day to our USA supporters!
My name is Darin Southam, Writer and Director of Reign of Judges: Title of Liberty-- a breakout concept short film, like Braveheart, based on a $40M major motion picture.
The first North American (Book of Mormon) war epic set in the pre-Columbian New World.
Late last year, we closed a record-breaking campaign as the Third ALL-TIME Highest Funded Short Film on Kickstarter. If you haven't seen it yet, please stop and watch our first Kickstarter below, before continuing:
Ok, so what's happened since then?    
We used the providential resources from our first Kickstarter ($171K+$50K raised outside Kickstarter) to over deliver on our campaign promises. In less than 2 months, we assembled an all-star cast and crew, including actors Ben Cross (Star Trek), Eugene Brave Rock (Wonder Woman), and Karina Lombard (Legends of The Fall). 
Name actors weren't expected or promised at our budget level but we went ahead and got them anyways (fist pump). 
It was a collaborative effort involving many different creeds, ideologies, and talents coming together to make an EPIC concept short film that will change the world and the face of cinema. Now, I’m Mormon and I love Mormons, but for the skeptics who think this is just a Mormon film, it may interest you to know... 
90% of our cast and crew were NOT Mormon.
We completed post production on our concept film in record time (a month early, in fact!) and premiered it on March 15, 2018. Over 700 people attended. Check out the audience reactions from our first premiere:
Los Angeles was next at the iconic Fox Village Theatre April 12th 2018 for another 700 people.
The response from our first two premieres was so tremendous it inspired us to a bold, first-ever (by demand) worldwide theatrical exhibition of a concept short film:
So, what happened next?     
Well... 
We sold nearly 10,000 tickets worldwide (most at $12 USD/each) in 34 U.S. States and 4 different countries. 
With 425 ratings in three months, our concept short film has...
Read IMDb Reviews
80% of all our ratings are a full 10 stars.
For comparison, the top-rated full length films on IMDb rank at 9.2 Stars. 
See full list
Here are some of our favorite reviews: 
"A worldwide phenomenon in the making! The impeccable music score combined with stunning sweeping visuals moves you emotionally from the first moments of the film."
- Jessie P., IMDb
"The (Braveheart) spirit of freedom has been captured again."
- Kim B., IMDb
"Ben Cross' performance was spine-tingling powerful... grabbed me by the throat!"
- Don L., IMDb
"I'm not Mormon but I love their literature & would be so excited to see (the full feature) when it reaches fruition."
- Gizmo F., Facebook
"This movie touched me deeply and emotionally... tears streaming down my face. I'm so thankful that Darin had the foresight to make this movie and bring Captain Moroni's story to the world... gripping from the first moment to the last."
- hickssl, IMDb
"I must tell you this looks tremendous. A superb job on the (VFX) and very impressed you have Mr. Cross in the picture!"
- Lance Alspaugh
KEEP SCROLLING DOWN FOR ENDORSEMENTS FROM AWARD-WINNING FILMMAKERS!
More audience reactions:
Since our first premiere (actually since our first Kickstarter) we've had hundreds of requests for Blu-rays and DVDs of our concept short film and behind the scenes. Blu-rays and DVDs weren't offered during our first Kickstarter so this brings us to today.      
Our SECOND Kickstarter. A campaign to fund our FULL feature by selling, for the first time on Blu-ray/DVD, our breakout concept short film and behind the scenes in...
A Limited First Edition Blu-ray/DVD combo
Limited First Edition Blu-ray/DVD Combo
Now, what makes these Limited First Edition Blu-ray/DVD combos so special?     
Well, for starters, this is the FIRST and ONLY major Book of Mormon war epic concept film ever made and owning a physical Limited Edition copy will be cherished forever.
We're only doing this once and these Limited Edition Blu-ray/DVD combos will be NUMBERED sequentially in order of of your pledges, so get yours early for a lower number!
Like First Edition copies of The Book of Mormon, we're only printing 5,000 LIMITED EDITION Blu-ray/DVD combos. Can you imagine how much you'll treasure a Limited First Edition copy of our breakout concept short film and behind the scenes when our FULL feature hits theaters worldwide as a blockbuster hit? 
Unlike HD Downloads, which tend to collect virtual dust in cyberspace, these Limited Edition Blu-ray/DVD combos are great tangible GIFTS. There's no better way to introduce this EPIC Book of Mormon war story to friends than with a riveting visual spectacle, action-packed and gripping, which instantly captivates even the most skeptical viewer. 
Our preferred media company (which does all the big Hollywood shows) can create 5,000 Limited First Edition Blu-ray/DVD combos uniquely numbered in order of purchase for $15,000. This is our base goal.   
But... our real goal is to pre-sell, right here on Kickstarter, 100,000 or more Blu-ray/DVD combos. 
Now, let's pause here for a moment. 
The entire purpose for which our initial 1,601 backers funded our concept short film was to inspire the funds for our FULL feature. 
100,000 Blu-ray/DVD combos sold represents over $1M toward our FULL feature and it could realistically propel us into full funding! And what if we sold 200K copies ($3M toward our full feature funding)? Or 300K copies ($4M toward our full feature funding). Now, it's far from likely we'll sell 2M Blu-ray/DVD combos here on Kickstarter and hit the $40M needed for full feature funding, BUT, can you see-- with your support-- how our concept short film can quite literally fulfill its intended purpose in a way none of us may have ever imagined?
Let me tell you why this matters and just how critical your support is right now. 
We've worked night and day, since our first campaign funded, hiring the right people, coordinating volunteers, reinvesting every dollar to keep our momentum healthy and we still have a long ways to go. I have not paid myself a salary since we began this wild ride. So, if you're wondering, rest assured, I'm in the trenches right beside you.
Typically, money raised privately for major films cannot be accessed until the full budget is obtained.  
But we need funds right now to hire additional writers and producers necessary to ready our full feature for production.  
At minimum, this Kickstarter will give us critical resources we can use immediately for these and other needs.  
I'm going to open the hood right now and tell you something that, I hope with all my heart, will make you stand on your feet and join me.
1,601 backers funded our concept film to inspire the funds for our FULL feature and, guess what-- It worked!! Yes, you heard that right, it worked. We have a small studio anxiously waiting to fund our full feature in 60-90 days. There's just one caveat. They require full creative control.
What's creative control?
In movies, it's the authority to decide the final cut of the film. Whoever has creative control decides all content that makes it into the final edit. For our concept short film, we shot over 6 pages of action in a day and a half! The pace and energy with which we executed all decisions during production would NOT have been possible had we not had full creative discretion. 
If Reign of Judges: Title of Liberty was just a film I invented in my head, I would've signed over creative control, collected a nice check, and moved on to my next film. I'm not so married to myself that I couldn't give up my life's work if it meant it was going to reach the world-- and this film isn't the only film I'm ever going to make. The fact is, this project isn't my "baby", it's God's. And I have a responsibility to make sure it's done right-- to honor the record it comes from while reaching the largest mainstream audience possible.
I've been at this long enough to know there's only two ways a film gets made. 
Private money or studio money; sometimes a combination of both, but whenever a studio funds a project they require creative control.  
With your generous pledge today, our FULL feature WILL be made and it will be one of the greatest epics this world has ever seen-- a film you and I, TOGETHER, will make. A film you and I, TOGETHER, can be proud of.  
We can either sit back and watch Hollywood feed us whatever films they want or we can unite behind a powerful film that has every potential to be one of the greats.
Stand with me and help us make the first North American war epic set in the pre-Columbian New World. Make your pledge now. Make history.
Sincerely,
Darin Southam
Writer/Director 
FACEBOOK | INSTAGRAM | TWITTER | YOUTUBE
JOIN OUR EMAIL LIST
ORIGINAL KICKSTARTER VIDEO MUSIC BY: Greg Dombrowski "Before Time"
ENDORSEMENTS
BEN CROSS on IMDb
KIETH MERRILL on IMDb
DAVID ATHERTON on IMDb 
 CLIFTON CHIPPEWA on IMDb
PAMELA CONN on IMDb 
 PHILIP NIU on IMDb
We have ONE paramount goal with this campaign: 
1. RAISE $1,000,000 OR MORE IN PLEDGES BEFORE AUG. 18TH (both in and outside of Kickstarter) through Blu-ray/DVD combo sales and other rewards offered. If we reach this goal, there's a 99% chance it will propel us into production on our FULL feature THIS YEAR. How? 
With tax incentives and foreign distribution commitments we can likely make our $40M film raising just $5-$8M privately. 
$1M puts us closer than you think!! Every Kickstarter reward offered is a vehicle to help us reach full feature funding. Believe me, we know $1M is lofty, BUT reaching it will allow us to make some critical hires NOW, instead of waiting till the full budget is reached. It will also prevent discouraging and costly delays to our full feature. So, there is much at stake.
The average budget for period-action war epics is $100-150M. Our budget at $40M is actually extremely low. Shooting 6 pages of action in a day and a half for our concept short film should engender confidence we can keep costs down but real Hollywood professionals aren't cheap. Writers with bankable credits charge between $150-$500K+ for feature writing. Producers charge even more. We have a 115-page budget that shows exactly where all production money goes but it's not something we can post publicly.
To be candid, I'm championing this movement full-time, reinvesting all profits toward our full feature and taking no salary, but it has (in all sincerity) reached the point this film needs to be my only focus. This means we need development funds (from this Kickstarter) to also allow me to start paying myself :).
Finally, here are some other costs we need to cover from our Kickstarter funds. Prepare yourself, it's pretty boring (and a little disheartening) but very important.
We don't get to keep all the money we raise on Kickstarter.
Let me break it down:
CAMPAIGN FEES: Kickstarter's fees, together with the credit card processing fees, come to about 8.5%. At our goal of $1M that's $85K! 
REWARDS & FULFILLMENT: We have to design, print, organize, and pay for rewards to be shipped. This includes paying someone else to fulfill the orders (so we can be off making the film you've helped us fund). That's why we appreciate you paying the extra shipping cost. That said, Kickstarter charges their fee on shipping costs too :(. So we're charged the fee on shipping costs even though we have to use those costs for, you know, shipping. Go figure. Total order fulfillment costs come to roughly 25%. At $1M raised, we'll get discounted bulk rates, but its still about $200,000. 
"DEATH AND TAXES": Kickstarter funds are taxable. Unfortunately, we do have to plan for the worst and the tax gorilla still remains at about 15-18%. At $1M raised that's $165K-- yikes! Believe me, we’re pulling out all the stops to keep tax liability low but we’re also above board around here so everything's gonna be legal.
DEVELOPMENT COSTS: As mentioned, hiring bankable writers and producers could cost upwards of $300,000+. Of course, we'll work our magic to keep costs down. We have a great track record so far, getting 3 name actors on our concept short film :)!
WE ARE NOT A CHARITY. We've tried hard to give you awesome reward choices.  
We’ve tried to give you as much reward value as possible while also considering that Kickstarter order fulfillment can be a nightmare. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The purpose of this Kickstarter is to fund our full feature in whole or in part through the creation and sales of Blu-ray/DVD combos. If we meet our goal, Blu-ray/DVD combos will be created, per the pledges made. We also have a track record of delivering on our campaign promises. We mentioned in our last Kickstarter that we could not control how our concept short film was received but we could control it's quality. We have delivered a product of substantial quality that has garnered exceptionally positive reviews. This also minimizes your risk. 

That said, this film project has the same risks as any other TV/Film project. Particularly, at this stage, there is a risk the full feature will never be made do to lack of funding. In such a case, all respective rewards tied to the completion of the full feature (Executive and Associate Producer credits, for example) will not be able to be delivered. In such cases, by pledging to this campaign, you are agreeing to consider those pledges a donation in the event we are unable to fund our full feature.

If we reach our goal, with the exception of rare extenuating and unforeseen circumstances, we GUARANTEE the fulfillment of all rewards not tied to the completion of our full feature within no more than 3 months from successful campaign close. We have already made a powerful and epic concept short film which has been received tremendously well. We partnered with the best talent in the industry to ensure our concept short film meets the absolute highest production standards and it definitely paid off.

We promise to our supporters to pour every bit of passion we have into this undertaking (just like we have done and demonstrated thus far). At the end of the day, if it isn't enough, the chips will fall where they may. This much we can tell you: The louder the statement our supporters make through this campaign the easier our job becomes.

The writer/creator of this project, Darin Southam, has written and directed over 30 successful film projects. He's never gone over budget and has always met his deadlines. Consequently, he also completed the concept short film for Reign of Judges early and under budget.

Our ongoing commitment is this: we will, in good faith, advocate the production of our full feature until it is produced and made available with an intended worldwide theatrical release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

To make smooth drawn animation you need a light source, and that's where my LED Light Pad really shines! (See what I did there?) The two registration pegs make for easy tracing. It has two brightness levels, is lightweight and powered via USB cable. The Light Pad's design has been been finessed and refined through multiple revisions, and we think you're going to love it! 
 Each kit includes enough premium paper and binding screws to make 4 flipbooks or 2 XL size flipbooks. This premium paper is the perfect size and thickness for smooth flipping. It is also acid free which means it will not yellow with time. 
 Bind your flipbook together with the included easy-to-use, reusable binding screws. Like the paper, each kit includes enough binding screws to make 4 flipbooks or 2 XL size flipbooks. You will love these things!
Triple your paper quantity by adding the 8X Paper Pack! If you're anything like me, you'll want to make LOTS of flipbooks, and that's why we've created the add-on 8X Paper Pack, which comes with enough extra paper & binding screws to make 8 additional flipbooks or 4 more XL flipbooks.
To add a printed copy of my "Cloudy with a Chance of Extinction" flipbook to any other pledge level, simply increase your total pledge by $6.
Easy! Follow my YouTube tutorials to learn at any skill level. I share flipbook videos and have many more tutorials on the way.
Here is our manufacturing schedule and what to expect once the campaign ends. We have several years of manufacturing experience and handling all of the logistics involved. This timeline is our best estimate but as with any Kickstarter project, it may be subject to change.
We will always be transparent about our manufacturing and fulfillment processes. As a backer you will have an inside look of each step along the way. We are committed to delivering rewards as quickly as possible! 
This project is EU, AU, CA and US friendly, which means that VAT and GST fees are prepaid for all backers in each of those regions! Backers in those regions will pay no extra customs fees or duties at the time of delivery. We have selected reputable logistics partners around the world to ensure reliable reward delivery.
Because the shipping weight of each pledge level is quite heavy, we have taken great care to calculate accurate shipping fees specific to each country. We make no profit on any of these shipping costs. 
Your pledges through Kickstarter make this kit a reality. Thank you!

campaign.story:
>>CLICK AQUÍ PARA VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL<<
Hey Kickstarter! Two years ago, we came up with an idea about how to create a new kind of flip book. We wanted to upgrade the classic format and bring it to a whole new level, and this is the result:
Molecularis is also an animated coloring book. You can use it in plenty of ways, by coloring, redrawing and varying its content with an endless number of possibilities. Use pencils, markers, watercolors, graphite, brushes, technical pens or whatever technique you prefer. 
By alternating the colors gradually from one picture to the next and using your favorite color palette, you can not only give the sequences their very own personality, but also bring them to life – as you see them ‘move’ when you flip through the pages.
Inside Molecularis, you’ll find a group of small and restless organisms that interact with each other as if they were being observed through a microscope.
Like all flip books, Molecularis relies on the principle of persistence of vision, which in other words, is exactly what your eyes and brain do when you watch a movie. In a flip book, every picture varies gradually from one page to the next, so by flipping the pages with your thumb, they generate the illusion of movement. This simple technique has been around since 1868 and played an important role in the birth of cinema.
Because the sequences are loop animated, after coloring or redrawing, you can create GIFs like this!
The sequences were designed and animated by Jossie Malis, co-founder of Flipboku and best known for his award-winning animated series Bendito Machine. Maybe you've come across this video from the first flip book we created for the show a couple of years ago. Find out more here.
                         If you observe the flip book in closer detail, you will notice that the edges are cut in a specific way, so that you can swap between the different sequences. This is the key to the optical illusion that gives Molecularis its unique feature of showing you six different animations in just one flip book. You'll have a blast watching people's faces when they see Molecularis for the first time and try to understand how it works! :D
And here's the secret: it all depends on the position of your thumb. You can switch between sequences by placing your thumb either in the upper corner, the center or the lower corner of the front edge of the book.
As there are 3 sequences on each side of the book, the images are arranged alternately. This means that you will have sequences 1, 2 and 3 on one side and 4, 5 and 6 when you turn the book around. To proceed with the coloring simply follow each sequence by jumping every 3 pages. You will have better control of the coloring process if you follow each animated element in every sequence. 
Every single Molecularis is largely hand-produced and the whole process requires a number of steps that rely on careful supervision. We spent a lot of time testing different paper qualities and consulted with several experts until we found the perfect match: high quality 100% recycled heavy paper with a semi-rough surface and a nice smooth finish. It's suitable for all kinds of different techniques and prevents colors from passing through it. Each Molecularis comes with 180 pages (90 sheets). 
 We have a weakness for good packaging, and that’s why we included a sleek slip case to keep your Molecularis safe after you use it. It prevents the pages from wearing out and by the way, it looks awesome on your shelf or wherever you want to keep it.
As a perfect complement to Molecularis we have created a learning flip book for anyone who wants to try ‘freestyle’ animation::  
Blanko is a flip book that contains 320 blank pages on which you can animate whatever comes to your mind. If you're new to animation, learn how to get started with 6 of the basic principles we have included: squash and stretch, anticipation, ease in - ease out, arcs, timing and exaggeration. You can use both sides of the flip book.
Watch this terrific animation by our good friend Nacho Rodríguez created on Blanko, featuring his character Mr. Coo:
PLAY

Molecularis and Blanko make a great couple, that's why we have bundled them up in a practical and sleek protective sleeve. You can also choose between several combinations:
We have partnered with Winsor&Newton, leading Brithish color-maker for more than 180 years, to create an awesome limited edition reward that includes a set of 12 assorted Watercolor Markers. This is a top quality marker set that will suit either the casual artist or the professional.
Each pen has a fine point tip on one end and a flexible brush tip on the other end. The colors are bright, lightfast and highly pigmented and they're designed to make gorgeous washes when combined with water. Because they have dual nibs, you can also use them for fine detail and sweeping line thicknesses. You won't find another marker quite like these ones.
NEW REWARD UPDATE!
Many of you asked us for more Winsor & Newton sets so we just unlocked a new limited edition reward! Those of you who have tried the Cotman Water Colours will agree with us, they are simply the best. Inside of this set you’ll find 12 high-quality, vibrant Cotman colours, an ergonomically designed brush pen with its own water reservoir and a mixing palette inside the lid. All packed into a slim, beautifully curved case that fits in your pocket, together with your Molecularis and/or Blanko. 
Despite its small size, a lot of work goes into creating a flip book like Molecularis. We've spent hours and hours on the design board, working hand in hand with our local printing house, cutting, binding and testing to achieve this result. Printing projects such as this one are only cost effective if you reach a certain quantity threshold, which is why we need your help to complete the final step – to finally bring the flip book to life and get it into the printers.
Flipboku is a project which comes straight from the hearts of animator and designer Jossie Malis and music composer Julie Reier. We love animation, design and flip books and we are thrilled at the idea of creating something you can manipulate with your hands, without any need for cables or batteries, just by using your thumb! 
Based on the Mediterranean island of Mallorca, Spain, Flipboku is meant to grow slowly as a side project, while we continue making films and sounds in our studio, Zumbakamera. The team is completed with the invaluable hands of illustrator, designer and official coloring artist Noemi Aiolo, and in the near future, with the collaboration of independent animators from planet earth.
                                                       We are extremely grateful for your support and would love to see you on board.
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped over 5,000 creators make their projects a reality.

GET READY TO DIVE  
• Turn the valve to 120psi and just breath, an on demand flow of air is then released form the regulator allowing you to dive hands free 15-20 minutes  
• A special collapsible high pressure hand pump very simply to use (just like a bicycle pump) can fill the entire tank anywhere you are a Carrying case for pump is included!  
•Cross-body bag ensures tight universal comfortable wear just clip on and dive.  
• I designed this to be simple and ready to go! just take it along with you and dive.
 Included in your Dive Portable Lungs Kit: Dive Portable Lungs tank, cross-body bag, 4 stage regulator, 3-Stage 3000psi hand pump with carrying case & a safety and instruction manual. Read FULLY to limit and avoid risks of diving with compressed air.
FAQ overview
Untrained Scuba Diving
Compressed Air Risks
these cover risks and how to avoid 
How to Below
PLAY

----Release & Liability Purchasing Terms----  
Safety Concerns!
Read the included safetyinstruction manual before diving.
 Maintain good mental and physical fitness for diving. Avoid being under the influence of alcohol or dangerous drugs when diving. 
 Avoid overexertion while in and underwater. Limit your maximum dive depth to 9 meters/30 feet.
 Breathe properly while diving - never hold in the air you breathe. Diving compressed air can be very dangerous and always a good idea to be certified for your own safety.
Never ascend to the surface without releasing air from your lungs to avoid Over Lung Expansion 
Pulmonary Barotrauma: During rapid ascent the air in the lungs expand, causing lung over expansion and rupture releasing bubbles into the bloodstream.
If you are not a certified diver: Practice in a pool until you get comfortable with breathing underwater "it is a mental training" to avoid underwater panick
Never Dive Alone: safety procedures that are intended to improve divers' chances of avoiding or surviving accidents in or under water by diving in a group of two
Water Pressure Compresses Air: Air in a diver's body air spaces and dive gear will compress as pressure increases (and expand as pressure decreases). PRESSURE AFFECTS MANY ASPECTS OF DIVING 
 Equalization As a diver descends, the pressure increase causes the air in their body's air spaces to compress. The air spaces in their ears, mask, and lungs become like vacuums as the compressing air creates a negative pressure. Delicate membranes, like the ear drum, can get sucked into theses air spaces, causing pain and injury. This is one of the reasons that a diver must equalize their ears for scuba diving. On ascent, the reverse happens. 
Decreasing pressure causes the air in a diver's air spaces to expand. The air spaces in their ears and lungs experience a positive pressure as they become overfull of air, leading to a pulmonary barotrauma or a reverse block. In a worst case scenario this could burst a diver's lungs or eardrums. To avoid a pressure-related injury (such as an ear barotrauma) a diver must equalize the pressure in their body's air spaces with the pressure around them. To equalize their air spaces on descent a diver adds air to their body airspaces to counteract the "vacuum" effect by breathing normally, this adds air to their lungs every time they inhale adding air to their mask by breathing out their nose adding air to their ears and sinuses by using one of several ear equalization techniques To equalize their air spaces on ascent a diver releases air from their body air spaces so that they do not become overfull by breathing normally, this releases extra air from their lungs every time they exhale ascending slowly and allowing the extra air in their ears, sinuses and mask to bubble out on its own Manuel will be included how to use properly 
 When purchasing the Dive Portable Lungs Kit you understand that you are using it at your own risk. fully understand the risks and challenges of diving READ over FAQ and Manuel 'Included with package'

campaign.story:
USING THE SCORKL WITH AND WITHOUT SCUBA TRAINING  
The Scorkl is safe, easy and for everyone. However, if you are not a trained scuba diver there are restrictions on use and risks to be aware of. Misuse of the Scorkl can be dangerous. Whilst decompression sickness (more commonly known as “the bends”) isn't much of a risk because of the depth and time restrictions of such a small cylinder, pulmonary damage (chest expansion injury) is nevertheless a risk if a user holds their breath during ascent or ascends too quickly.
Non-scuba trained users should not use the Scorkl below 3m depth or more than five times in one day. Staying above 3m dramatically reduces this risk of pulmonary damage (although does not eliminate it entirely). Each purchaser will be provided with an information kit informing them of this (and other) risks of using the Scorkl as well as strategies to avoid them. These strategies will include, but not be limited to, staying above 3m in depth and not holding one's breath and/or exhaling during ascent, and not ascending too quickly.  
Scuba-trained users will be able to use the Scorkl below 3m at their discretion but they too will be warned of the same risks.  
The Scorkl is only intended for shallow water use. We recommend that scuba-trained users not use the Scorkl below 10m and that non-scuba-trained users stay above 3m in depth as mentioned above.  
Each Scorkl comes fitted with a pressure gauge so that the user can know how much air remains in the cylinder at any time.  
AIR QUALITY
The Scorkl can be filled either directly from a scuba tank or from our high-pressure hand pump. If filled from a scuba tank that itself has been filled by a commercial compressed air supplier, the air can be assured to be of good quality because of industry supplier standards. These standards are concerned mainly with carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, oil and water levels. Since the Scorkl hand pump doesn't have as many working parts as a mechanical dive compressor, and is muscle-powered rather than petrol powered, the risk of contamination from latent carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide is dramatically reduced. This is the same for oil contaminants. Notwithstanding this, each Scorkl pump comes fitted with an air filter which is comprised of the same materials, and performs the same function, as a filter fitted to a mechanical dive compressor. The Scorkl filter should be replaced after fifty refills and extras will be available for purchase after the conclusion of the Kickstarter campaign.  
EQUIPMENT STANDARDS, CARE AND MAINTENANCE  
The Scorkl cylinder and regulator are made to the same international specifications and standards as normal scuba cylinders and regulators and need to be visually inspected and/or tested as regularly as the guidelines in your country require (some are different). This may be as regularly as every year or every one hundred dives.  
The information kit provided to each purchaser will include information regarding recommended best practice methods for care and maintenance of each of the Scorkl components (cylinder, regulator, filter, hand pump, case).
                      The Scorkl cylinder is manufactured to the same specifications and manufacturing standards as a normal SCUBA cylinder
The Scorkl regulator is an always-on, breathe-on-demand, balanced single stage regulator and uses the same time proven technology found in regulators used by SCUBA divers around the world. Each Scorkl comes with a pressure gauge which tells you how much air is left at any time
Each Scorkl comes with a FREE scuba tank refill adapter which enables you to refill the Scorkl from a scuba tank in seconds.
If you want to be able to refill the Scorkl whenever and wherever you like, we have developed a high-pressure hand pump option. See below for how it works.
  The hand pump filter (below) filters air moisture and impurities
Adventure Case to transport and store your full Scorkl kit safely 
  High-pressure hand pump can pump to 3,000psi+, filling the Scorkl with enough air to last up to 10 minutes underwater. It achieves these extreme pressures by using an intricate four-stage system:
  The Scorkl regulator and high pressure hand pump have been in development for the last twelve months, with multiple sample orders manufactured and refined.
    FREE SHIPPING GLOBALLY

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

The Scorkl and hand pump require high-precision manufacturing and high-quality materials since they both operate with air stored at high pressures. The primary components are: the Scorkl cylinder, Scorkl regulator, hand pump chambers, hand pump rods, scuba tank refill adapter and hand pump air filter. All components have already been manufactured to high quality during sample runs.

The primary risk is of production delays. Coordinating with an overseas factory and maintaining quality throughout every step is a challenge. Fulfillment and shipping becomes a hurdle when dealing with thousands of orders. We will not rush through these steps and will tackle them carefully, one by one. We will take the Scorkl to the "design for manufacturing" step soon, and the target is to ship out units in October 2017.

There is some risk that items will not come exactly as pictured, due to manufacturing considerations. The promised function will not be different, and any style changes if any will be iterative and non-significant to the original look and feel.

campaign.story:
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Two New Rewards! 
Thanks to the overwhelming response so far the NeoLucida XL, I’m excited to announce TWO NEW NeoLucida XL Reward Tiers!
Your pledge for NeoLucida XL at these two tiers will support NeoLucida donations to US public Middle and High School art programs in need.
$5: Your pledge will go towards the cost of NeoLucida XLs to be donated to public school art programs.
$105: Get One/Give One. You get a NeoLucida XL delivered to you. I will also send one NeoLucida XL to a public school art program in the United States. 
Want to know more? Read Campaign Update #2.
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
The NeoLucida XL: Even easier to trace what you see.
The NeoLucida is a modern reinterpretation of the camera lucida, a 19th century optical drawing aid. It superimposes an image of your subject onto your paper. You see your pencil and your subject at the same time. Trace what you see!
Back on Kickstarter!
 In 2013, along with fellow Art Professor Golan Levin, I launched the NeoLucida project on Kickstarter. Our goal was to make this amazing—but obsolete—tool available again. We hoped there was a small group of art/tech/history nerds like us who might want to try a camera lucida, but couldn’t afford a vintage one. To our surprise, over 11,000 (!) backers helped us make many more NeoLucidas than we ever planned. Most had never heard of a camera lucida; they just wanted to draw and the NeoLucida gave them an entry point. We scaled up production by bringing Kickstarter veterans Big I Design on board as manufacturing partners. We even won a prestigious Core77 Design Award along the way! There are now over 25,000 NeoLucidas helping people in 90 countries draw from real life. 
"Um, this is hard!"
One thing became clear from the feedback. People said, “This is harder than I thought!” We said, “We know!” After all, the original NeoLucida copied the prism design of vintage 19th century camera lucidas, which made sharp, clear images, but has a tiny viewing area. To us, it supported the idea that great artists of the past were still incredibly skilled; using a tool wasn't "cheating." This was a provocative media archeology project: NeoLucida users could test what it was like to be an artist 200 years ago. 
But thousands of people were just excited by using a tool that might make drawing a little less frustrating. Many people appreciated the art history story, but they just wanted to draw. Maybe they used to draw and gave up as a teenager. Maybe they never learned to draw but always wanted to. Many parents wanted to support their kids' creative impulses. The NeoLucida offered an accessible and inexpensive motivation to draw. 
I was inspired. Years of lecturing and running NeoLucida drawing workshops in a half-dozen countries gave me direct exposure with hundreds of aspiring artists. With all the feedback in mind, I went back to the drawing board. 
After two years of research and testing prototypes, the NeoLucida is back! People asked for a larger viewing area, but why stop there? The all new design has an extra large viewer to make drawing from life just a bit easier. Say hello to the NeoLucida XL.
  First, A Little Art History.
If you wanted to make a realistic image in the days before photography was invented, you had to draw it.
For centuries, artists and inventors developed clever optical drawing instruments to assist with the difficult task of drawing from real life. Devices with mirrors, lenses, and prisms helped with the most challenging part of drawing: flattening a three-dimensional world into the two dimensions of your paper.
Portrait of Mrs. John Mackie, by Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres, 1816 (Photo by me while doing research at The Victoria & Albert Museum, London). Ingres' drawings are meticulous but tiny, leading some scholars to suggest Ingres used a camera lucida
Drawing would be so much easier if you could hold up a piece of glass to your subject and trace its likeness directly onto the flat glass. Your page and your subject would be aligned; you wouldn't have to look away from your subject to see your drawing. Simple devices like the Sighting Grid did precisely this. Instead of glass, a grid of wires made a reference plane. 
Sighting Grids by Robert Fludd (Left) (1617-21) and John Bate (right) (1634). The simplest of drawing instruments, the Sighting Grid provides a flat reference plane for translating the 3D world to the 2D page
Sighting Grids were accurate, but slow and cumbersome. As optical technology advanced from the early 17th century onwards, artists and inventors found ways to project images onto paper for tracing. The most advanced of these technologies was the camera lucida, invented by scientist Sir William Hyde Wollaston in 1807. A prism acts like a beam-splitter: part of your vision is directed towards your subject, part towards your paper. This overlap makes it possible to trace directly from real life. 
The NeoLucida XL borrows from this tradition of simple, effective drawing instruments, but leveraging some modern technology to make a simple and inexpensive version of these ancient tools. 
Want a little more history and a look at the vintage tools that inspired the NeoLucida? Check out this chat and demo with Norman Chan of Adam Savage's Tested.com: 
How does it work?
The main suggestion we got for the original NeoLucida was: "Can't you just make the prism bigger?" Actually, no. When you look into the prism, you look at the exposed edge of the prism. It doesn't matter how big the prism is, you still look at the edge. And as the prism gets bigger, the more the image shifts when you move your head. This is bad for tracing (trust me, we made and tried larger prisms. No good). To make the viewing area bigger, the NeoLucida would have to be completely redesigned. Ditch the prism and find other materials to create the ghost reflections.
The NeoLucida XL setup: Clamp to a table, position the viewer over your page with your subject in front of you.
The NeoLucida XL uses mirror and glass to combine a virtual ghost image of your subject and the real view of your hand. Setting it up is easy: 
Clamp the NeoLucida XL to a table or sturdy drawing board. 
Bend the adjustable gooseneck so that the viewer is facing your subject and positioned over your paper. 
Look straight down into the viewer to see your page and a ghost image of your subject superimposed. 
Trace what you see!
  Part of your vision goes through the glass to your pencil. Simultaneously, part of your vision bounces off the glass, then the first-surface mirror, then out to your subject. The result is a ghost image on your page. 
Look down into the NeoLucida XL and a ghost image of your subject appears on top of your page.
Here's an actual view through the NeoLucida XL. You can see your hand and your subject superimposed. This drawing only took 4 minutes, but proportion and perspective are rendered accurately. Tracing really works!
No matter your skill level, the NeoLucida XL helps you make more accurate drawings. Proportion—the relationships between elements of your subject—and perspective—accurate rendering of space—are laid out for you in the ghost image. You can even compose your scene before you draw so your subject fits on your paper the way you want it to. All of this means you can focus on the most important part of drawing: putting pencil to paper. Controlling a pencil to make beautiful lines takes practice. With the NeoLucida XL, you spend less time on laying out your drawing and more time drawing. 
Special Features
The basic elements in the NeoLucida XL are simple enough: A piece of glass and a mirror placed at a certain angle to each other. This arrangement is the same as it was in the early 19th century. After testing dozens of samples and prototypes, we've developed the NeoLucida XL to be the best version of the glass-and-mirror camera lucida ever made. 
Glass and Mirror. The quality of the glass and the mirror are key to make the camera lucida ghost image as sharp and clear as possible. The mirror we use is a First Surface mirror. Typical mirror is made with a reflective surface applied to the rear of a piece of glass. This is how most commercial mirrors are made. Because the light travels through the glass to get to the mirror, there are additional reflections from the glass surface and tiny distortions from scattering light. This isn't usually a problem for your bathroom mirror, since the mirror is thin and you're not standing that close to it. But if you want a precise reflection with your eye up close to it, you need a sharp reflection. Usually used in scientific applications, a first surface mirror has only one surface reflecting light rays. One surface exposed, one crisp reflection. 
Typical mirror (left) has a reflective surface on the rear face of the glass. This causes minor distortions and soft reflections as light bounces and scatters between reflective layers.
Portability. Making the NeoLucida viewer larger makes drawing easier, but it also makes the device bulkier. To make the NeoLucida XL as portable as the original NeoLucida, the glass-and-mirror viewer neatly folds into a flat package. Slide it into the custom pouch provided, and toss it in your bag with your art supplies. Easy! The folding action also protects the glass and mirror inside a sandwich of hard plastic to keep the delicate optics safe while in transit. 
The NeoLucida folds up for easy storage.
  At just 10 ounces and slim in profile, the NeoLucida XL fits in the handy custom pouch provided. Easy to toss in your bag!
  When folded, the NeoLucida XL is only 1 inch at its thickest. Compact!
Legacy Support. The NeoLucida XL is an all new optical design, but it uses the same adjustable gooseneck from the original NeoLucida. If you have the original NeoLucida, you can swap viewers between the gooseneck stands. Save space! Carry both NeoLucida viewers but only one clamp!
Lighting Control. The NeoLucida XL comes with a removable shader to help balance the lighting. It's like custom sunglasses for your NeoLucida! Is the page too bright to see the ghost image? Insert the shader in the bottom slot to dim the image of your page. Is your subject too bright and you can't see your page? Insert the shader in the forward position. When you're not using it, store the shader in the rear of the NeoLucida XL viewer.  
If your subject is too bright and it's hard to see your page, use the Shader in the front slot. This will dim your subject view to make your page easier to see.
  If the page is too bright and it's hard to see your subject, use the Shader in the bottom slot. This will dim your page view to make the subject easier to see.
A little easier for the little ones. I have two daughters who love to draw, but they couldn't use the original NeoLucida. At 8 and 4 years old, the NeoLucida's requirements of precise eye placement with a tiny prism made it frustrating to them. The NeoLucida XL isn't a toy, but it was made with kids in mind. I've tested it with kids and found that, depending on the skill level, children as young as 6 and 7 can draw with the NeoLucida XL! 
That's my 8-year-old daughter using the NeoLucida XL to draw her favorite teddy bear. Fun!
Almost every child draws. But many give up in their teenage years when drawing skills don't seem to improve. Practicing with tools like the NeoLucida XL to advance skills can help keep kids drawing into adulthood. 
Backed by Primary Research
The NeoLucida XL isn't just a product, it's the result of years of primary research. As an art professor, the NeoLucida is part of a decade of research into the relationship between technology and art history. I have one of the most complete camera lucida collections in the world, and have used this personal collection to reverse engineer both the original NeoLucida and the NeoLucida XL. 
One idea, a century apart. The Magic Art Reproducer (left) from 1952 and A. Alexander's Graphic Mirror (right) from 1840 both use angled glass and a mirror to create the ghost image.
The glass-and-mirror design is inspired by several different historical designs. The desire to draw more accurately from life is an old one; 19th century finely crafted brass devices and mid-20th century toys all responded to demand from aspiring artists. 
Vintage glass-and-mirror camera lucidas from my personal collection provided primary research for developing the NeoLucida XL. At left, the 1952 Magic Art Reproducer. Center, A. Alexander's Graphic Mirror (1840).
  Two years of NeoLucida workshops gave me first-hand experience with users. Clockwise from top left: Demo at Open Hardware Summit, MIT; Manifest Drawing Center, Cincinnati; Anderson Ranch Arts Center, Aspen; Children's Camp, Valdai, Russia.
Rewards
(Prices include WORLDWIDE shipping!)
Let's get drawing!
Who's behind this? 
I'm Pablo Garcia, Associate Professor at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC) and the history of drawing and technology is my life. I've spent a decade researching historical and contemporary drawing techniques and tools. I have over 30 different camera lucidas spanning 200 years, making it one of the largest and most complete private collections of its kind in the world. I also run drawingmachines.org, a growing archive reference site covering 600 years of drawing technology. With Golan Levin, I made the award-winning NeoLucida in 2013, earning over $424,000 from 11,406 backers in our first-ever Kickstarter. I also exhibit art and lecture about art, design, and technology. Find out more here. Or tweet me!
Manufacturing partner Big Idea Design is Chadwick Parker and Joe Huang. Veterans of 21 Kickstarter campaigns, Big Idea Design has earned over $1.4 million from their high-quality titanium pens and clever tool designs. As manufacturing partners for the original NeoLucida, Big Idea Design helped us scale from a few hundred planned units to tens of thousands after our Kickstarter went viral. 
Want to keep up with NeoLucida? Want to dive deep into the history of optical drawing tools? Visit us at NeoLucida.com for more. Or keep up to date by following NeoLucida on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've made over 25,000 prism NeoLucidas in the last three years. We've got our manufacturing process down, and I have been to China several times to oversee production. So are we confident that the NeoLucida XL will be delivered as promised? Yes. But there are some new challenges we have our eyes on: 

• The new NeoLucida XL has some moving parts the original NeoLucida didn't have. When we get to producing molds there is a chance that parts don't fit or move smoothly. We have a plan to do final prototype modeling before we invest in the injection molds, but if there are problems, there's a chance for a delay if we need to make new molds. 

• The glass and mirror are thin and very precisely cut to be as flat as possible. This gives the truest image for tracing. We have planned for a higher-than-usual spoilage rate before we assemble the NeoLucida XL to account for possible irregularities and damage as we produce and package the NeoLucida XL.

But our team is battle-tested and have been manufacturing high-quality NeoLucidas together for three years. We are ready for this newest phase of the NeoLucida Project!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SELFLY is based on existing technology, making the developmental risks low. Our experienced team has already developed a few working prototypes, which have been tested and perform well, providing us with feasibility of the product. This gives us confidence in SELFLY and its development.
Mini drones have become quite popular in recent years, and SELFLY is a very simple one, so the technological challenge isn’t high. Since it uses existing technology in order to enable a new kind of mini drone use, compacting it into a phone case is possible to implement - we've done it!
Our products prime purpose is providing the user with a convenient and available option of taking photos from a new different angle. The 1st pilot view video stream is recordable, but its primary purpose is to control the camera in order to choose the perfect angle for a selfie picture. Our drone is VERY stable, however, a 99$ product obviously does not include a stabilizing gimbal. If you are looking for a drone to capture professional stabilized video you will have to spend 600$ and more, this is beyond the scope of this product. 

We do not aim to replace, nor compete with large and complex drones. However, if you are looking for a great affordable replacement for a selfie stick to take an exciting new angle for your photos, this is the product for you. 

SELFLY’s main clip shows the target of the final product. With your support we will get there. Although we have several working prototypes, the current prototype is yet to include the full and final functionality and components to be included in the product, and in order to reach the manufacturing stage further development should be carried out. However, full functionality as described is fully feasible.
Our subcontractors are well-known companies, and are quite experienced in the mini drone tech field, making our work plans and budget expectations well-planned in order to accurately estimate the development process through to shipping.
We are sure that our product will meet your expectations.
